text: They have no vegetarian options for lunch. The veggie stack was a packet of salt on sour vegetables that I couldn't eat. The servers have no ideas for vegetarians, I mean no customization.

I wish I could give no stars at all. Horrible service, horrible food. Waiter is very cold and unfriendly. The pasta tastes like it was boiled and they put marinara over it. It was cold, no taste, nothing special for the price you pay. They were nice enough to take the food back. But I came in hungry and leaving hungry. Bad food!

We went in for a traditional breakfast, and returned every day of our stay at Caesars.  Did breakfasts, late lunches, and great full meals with a bottle of wine.  Chef Matthew has developed a great menu for each. Try the Huevos Rancheros, or items from the Skinny Menu, or his Home Fries with sweet potato pieces. The salmon fillet with citrus spinach was excellent. 

The Cafe is considered casual dining, the ambience was relaxed but the wait staff was friendly and attentive;  so though the prices are Vegas Strip (you are at Caesars), it was great value - excellent menu, attentive service.

We loved the location just across the main lobby from the casino hustle.

Aggressive food poisoning from their chicken wings - do not eat here. Additionally, the restaurant first tried to deny the situation, then suggested that if we went to find a doctor in Vegas, we could claim that against their medical insurance. I told them that people with severe food poisoning are not in a position to roam around Vegas looking for a doctor, especially on the day we were travelling home. I asked if they could help bring a doctor to us, or help us keep our hotel room until the evening, but no. Please avoid this restaurant at Caesars Palace in Vegas.

Great spot to eat dinner and have some drinks. Food was yummy. They have basically any drink you could want, with some liquors bars don't usually carry. Friendly staff with great eye candy. I'd definitely go back.

The food, even if half the cost, would not have been worth the price. My wife and I went because she was hungry and we were seeing a show at Caesar's Palace. She got the Margherita pizza, which was pretty solid, but my meal was not good at all. I got the grilled free range chicken off of the skinny menu and it was bad. The chicken was dry, way over cooked, and stringy. I literally had to put some water in my mouth while chewing to soften it up. The asparagus was bland and chewy to the point I had to cut it in individual pieces to swallow because it was not al dente and my teeth couldn't cut through it (and I have some respectable chompers).  The brown rice was good, but hey, I never met a plate of rice I didn't like!  Overall, it wasn't good, and given the price, it was downright bad.  Go elsewhere and spend your money.

Great place that is open 24/7. We got the Cubano sandwich (on 2 seperate occasions) which we split and they did not charge us a plate fee (for splitting) which was nice! Great food and atmosphere, and the manager came over personally to check on us which we appreciated. Would highly recommend!

Living in vegas we don't tend to eat out on the strip but as we had friends visiting from out of town we spent a day doing the tourist thing!  Came across Cafe Americano the other night and decided to stop for some dinner and drinks.  I ate the giant meatball and my friends had a Cuban sandwich and a pizza - food was so tasty and although a little high in price we expected it for Caesars Palace but to be honest I feel the price was worth it.  Drinks were tasty especially the espresso martini!  The best thing about this place is the service - our server was Danielle and she was excellent - such a nice lady and incredibly attentive to us.  We were also checked on by the manager (can't remember his name but he was British) - he stopped and chatted to make sure everything was ok a couple of times.  Will definitely recommend this place to my friends!
Late night Robbie is the best bartender this side of the Mississippi. Don't sleep on this place

Walked by this restaurant on several different stays at Ceasars. Had tickets for Reba and thought let's have dinner and be close to the show. HUGE Mistake- 45 minutes to get our food (with an almost empty restaurant) then 2 out of 4 meals were incorrect. We sent one meal back completely, I ended up sharing my meal and the other meal was barely touched because it was basically inedible. The server apologized and sent the manager over who basically offered to 'comp' the cup of coffee!  Really! Very poor service, we will never come back to this restaurant and will probably think twice about staying at Ceasars palace.

Had breakfast here this morning and it was pretty good. It is one of the only places other than Starbucks to get breakfast at Caesars Palace. They have healthy options on the menu and the food was fresh. They do not have very many hot sauce options. Only Siracha and Tabasco, which are not my favorite on eggs.
Great breakfast, quick service and our waiter was friendly and provided good advice about our adventures of the day.
Everyone is SO HELPFUL and friendly and at your service. Food is awesome. Definitely coming back next time I'm in town!

Food was delicious and the staff even better. Our waitress Jessica was amazing, attentive, and very affable (manager was just a great). I highly recommend this place for breakfast or just enjoying drinks with a staff that understands the little things that make for a great dining experience.

We tried this place cause it looked pretty nice, but I can say it's too over pricy for this quality of food. And service sucks! 
We asked waitress for jelly for toast and he defiantly forgot about us. Waited 10minutes for our receipt. And on top of that my burger of tomato had sticker on it.

Our entry here was a bit of a hangry decision, as in I'm hungry... Now... This will do! It was convenient and suited us at the time. The service was fair and we had a pleasant evening although I feel it was fairly pricey for what you got. It was a good stop gap for us.
Waited for 15 minutes in prominent area of restaurant - completely ignored - left - avoid!!

We went to Cafe Americano on a Monday for lunch, and got just what we wanted- a simple sit-down that served good food.

I had the chicken barbecue sandwich- a sandwich that features chicken with a guava barbecue sauce, cheese (I think it was Swiss), a fried onion ring, and bacon. All of this delicious middle was put in a sesame brioche bun. The chicken was tender, the bun sweet and fluffy, the bacon not too salty, and the onion ring on point. The only complaint I have is that they didn't put enough cheese on the sandwich, but it didn't make it or break it. All of this came with fries.

Overall, the service was good. The major issue that you will find in most of the bad reviews is that it's pricey. But with a sushi place selling 90 dollar sushi not too far away, I think that the prices are justifiable.

enjoy my time in this establishment.  the service was.professiobal ,friendly and the food was good. 
would definitely cone back.
Melanie  was fantatic !!!
Magic hat elect wow

Our waiter was friendly, however breakfast potatoes were undercooked/hard so we sent it back, the new potatoes looked nothing like the previous ones and were still hard. I ordered a well done classic burger and was given a raw one, sent it back they brought me a different burger w/jalapeños & avacado. Told a different waitress that our experience was not good and she responded with "is there anything else" and just walked away before we could answer. Two thumbs down
My wife and I tried the Bellini, mimosa, latte, and corned beef hash. Surprisingly good food and drinks with friendly service.

My girlfriend and I decided to have breakfast at this place because it was close to the hotel we were staying in. My girl really liked how the place looks and she insisted on going there even though I've heard before its expensive. 
We go in, nice atmosphere, the servers were good but each one of them had too many tables. We order a breakfast burrito, a cafe americano frittata and orange juice. Everything was not only looking great but was really delicious too. But these prices! We could have eaten at least twice as much for this amount of money somewhere else. I know that Vegas is not a cheap town as a whole but the other places in which we ate were with much more reasonable prices. 
So even though my girl and I loved the place and the food, we wont be paying so much money for a meal again.

It was my first trip to Vegas this week! We stayed at Caesars, and had an amazing experience! But by far the best part of my trip was the service I got from the bar at Cafe Americano! Patrick was so pleasant (fairly handsome as well) and the drinks were great! Props to him! I will definitely be back!

We ate the all American breakfasts on the lunch menu. Food was decent, but service was terrible. After being seated immediately we waited about 5 minutes as waiters were flying right by us without stopping, before going back to hostess stand and asking for a server. Manager came over and apologized and attempted to take our entire order without writing any of it down. A server stepped in to save him at the last second. 

We never saw a server again until we had to flag someone down to ask for the check. A food runner brought our food to us in a timely manner but the server never came back to check on us.  It was as if his area was on the opposite side of the restaurant because we literally never saw him even though plenty of other servers walked past our table many times.

On our recent Vegas vacation, we stumbled into the Americano and I had the best sandwich I have ever eaten! The Cuban sandwich had nearly 2" high of pulled pork, a perfect size slice of real country baked ham, Guyere cheese, mayo, pickles and onions, all on a grilled slab of bread with no grease. One-half of the sandwich would've been more than enough. It came with choice of french fries or salad. I had the salad, all a spring mix of greens. My husband got a Reuben with 2" tall of corned beef and the traditional Reuben items. He got the fries, a very generous, very hot portion. Great atmosphere, sandwiches served on a thick wooden cutting board, linen napkins...manager (in a suit) stopped by our table. Highly recommend!

Well if you can get past the over priced casual menu, maybe the almost average service will be acceptable.  When it came time to pay our bill we were asked cash/credit or room?  We were not given a bill but were told "about $50" (2 unsweetened teas, appetizer meatball and personal veggie pizza) so we handed him $60.   He came back and said "it was $52, thanks" and walked away just taking the change!!!!  
The 3 stars were solely because the food was decent.  
I failed to mention above the pizza was messed up and he tried to talk us into taking it anyway!!!! 
Over priced and under delivered .....

We stopped in for a small bite to eat for breakfast and were promptly greeted by our server. That was one of the 3 times we saw him all morning, his presence was bare. When ordering he asked me what kind of toast I'd like which led me to believe my meal came with toast. Wrong we were charged $8 for the toast I barely nibbled on. So watch out for sly upcharges... I asked for a cup of hot water to drink, at first the cup seemed clean until I noticed the hot water loosening the dirt off the cup which was now floating around my cup. So of course I requested a new one, but had to ask the manager because our server was no where to be found. The manager himself brought me an even dirtier one this time the inside was stained brown and streaky. Gross! Kudos to him for not looking at the cup before he brought it to me. After my boyfriend brought it to his attention he offered us the dirty cup discount which covered the toast I didn't really want to begin with. Thankfully the food was decent.

The meal was good. Little wait time.  As a matter of fact, i had to tell the waiter to stop hovering over the table until we decided.  Price was ridicuolous for what you get. Lettuce on hamberger was not cut for hamburger. Just one large leaf foldwd in half.  The manager ran past us without stopping in the middle of the meal and asked us how the food tasted. He did not wait for our answer. 

Bottom line, food tastes good, price was at least double what should be paid, wait staff was attendant, manager doesnt care what you think.

The manager on named Carlos went above and beyond the Call of Duty. I am blown away by the OUTSTANDING customer service that I received here. Not only did the manager, but also the man working behind the bar,  made an effort to make me feel happy and welcomed. Ordering food from here was a very pleasant experience and I can't wait to go back in the future. Plus my house salad with ranch was delicious! Thank you guys!

Two of us were walking the Strip and stopped by for a drink and a snack. 
We sat on the patio and got guacamole and chips, and 2 margaritas. 

The bill was $48. Here's the thing, I am not complaining about the price - I realize it's expensive to eat and drink on the Strip. However, give me some value for my money - the margs were made from a mix with cheap tequila. If I am going to spend $15 for a cocktail, that's fine. 
But: Make. Me. A. Cocktail. 
By that I mean, put some tequila, triple sec and lime juice in a shaker and go to town on it. I can get the shitty marg mix anywhere. 

Then there was the guac - it was so cold it was almost frozen, like it had been in the fridge since someone made it several hours earlier. Again, if I am going to spend $15 for an appetizer:
Make. Me. A. Frigging. Appetizer. 
Don't just go grab something out of the fridge that the crew on the last shift made. 

Our server was a super nice guy, too bad the food and drink didn't meet up to the effort he put into giving us a good experience. I couldn't stiff him on the tip, so I added 20% and walked out of there $60 lighter and unsatisfied.

To be clear - I am not complaining about the price, it's the value that is lacking.

There are a lot of places on the Strip that I would go to before I went back to this place.
$50 for a plain lettuce wrapped burger, a few slices of grilled onion, garden salad, fries and coffee. The waiter was nice but service was slow. A waste of money but I was in a hurry and starving.
Just like to say breakfast was really good, we will definetly come back , best on the strip  !

I came here for breakfast and the food was good. I had the All American Breakfast from the menu. It was delicious. Not only that but the service was good. Our waiter was attentive and very nice. I will be coming back!

This place is in the lobby at Caesars!  I Grabbed a bite here for dinner at the bar. I Was simply looking for a quick burger or fries, and on Ryan the bartender's recommendation, I tried the patty melt.  It was absolutely fantastic.  Like--melt in your mouth insanely good and I'm irritated with myself that I didn't go back and have it again for breakfast today before leaving Vegas!  Great open bar--plenty of people watching, and super attentive bartending staff.  

It's NOT CHEAP and you can expect to pay $20-$25 for a burgers and fries --but it's convenient and delicious ..and considering the location .....when in Rome!  
 Delish!!

So we ended up here right before a concert when we were STARVED and had minimum time to eat. The place was pretty empty around 7p and the prices seemed a tad high for a "cafe" but we didn't have much of a choice. 

We got 2 pasta dishes, the prosciutto pizza and the pork belly nachos for 4 people.  The pizza flavors were SO good - I only wish there was more prosciutto.  The pasta was perfectly cooked and the pork belly nachos....OMG I wish I had saved much much more room for those...they were SO good. 

The drinks were also very good, although I think a bit light on the alcohol... 

Overall, a solid choice for dinner - the ambiance is really nice despite the fact that it's called a cafe, the food portions were solid but not overwhelming and the food itself was great.

$138 dollars for eggs and pancakes, tea and chocolate milk, 2 adults 1 senior and a toddler.I was charged $9dlls for a side of bacon (2 strips of bacon) This place is a rip-off!. I was told that they are under new management but this place has been historically bad...My advise is don't eat here might as well hit the buffet you will pay less and have a lot more variety. BTW I order the skinny omelet and it was not good at all...the service was Ok the food took quite a while everything else (pancakes and eggs where just ok not great) not worth the money...

It's in a prime location, right near the hotel check in and looks nice. It's open 24 hours, but the items aren't. I wanted a couple of smoothies to go late night to rehydrate, at like 2 am, and was told they don't do them until 6 am. I came back in the morning to get some before I checked out. 

I tried the red smoothie and the tropical, 16 oz each. $11 a piece. Taste was lacking and not very cold. Would've been better off with a Jamba Juice. Seems like a tourist trap. Lobby location, nice look, high prices, subpar everything else. I'm sure if you want to get drunk at the bar, it's great, but there's plenty of other options for that.
I ordered a pizza that was great my Sister ordered clam chowder And it was really good i would definitely come back.
Food was great but the service sucks had to ask for a refill on the coffee 3 times before I got it

The food is ok, but very overpriced and service is the worst I've ever gotten. For food that expensive, you'd think service would be decent but unfortunately not. 

Scott S was out waiter and he was very rude. I ordered "All American Breakfast" ($22) and he just responded with "Ok...what do you want?". I thought he didn't hear me the first time so I repeated myself. Then he says "Are you ready or not?". I responded "Yes, I just told you the All American Breakfast". Then he says "You want bacon or sausage or what?". Who takes order likes this? Usually you ask "How would you like your eggs?" or something like that.

I concur with the reviews regarding customer service and training. 

My friend and I walked in and asked the hostess if they had soup, she nodded yes and then I asked her what kind. She showed us the menu and we decided on the Clam Chowder, we told her we wanted calm chowder, she then asked where we would like to sit and we told her the bar. 

Couple mins later bar tender (super nice guy) showed up and asked us if we wanted anything and we told him no, we already had drinks and had placed our order.

10mins later I asked if they had a bread basket for people waiting on food..... the hostess went and got the manager who in a very condescending tone asked if we had food coming...we told her yes we had placed an order for soup 


Another 10-15mins pass and she brings us the bread basket and informed us they were still making the soup...  another 10 mins pass and she asks the bartenders if we ordered soup through them, they both responded no. She then comes and tells us that there is no order for our soup and the hostess never put in the order.....


At this point I am pissed, my friend was hungry she had an extraction and could only drink soup... and I State that to the waitress who asked us if everything is okay. She ran back to the kitchen and reappeared with 2mins with the soup and bread...

And while the bartender was awesome he did charge my card for my friends soup and walked up with the receipt...my friend had cash in hand to pay him...


Bunch of errors, bunch of misunderstanding, the manager is super rude and condescending. Just awful experience. 


Food was great, but I didn't order the soup and was charged for something I didn't personally place.

Ok, so we're staying at Caesars, needed food. We found this place. Not only was the food fresh and amazing, the staff (Angela & Michael outside) rocked out worlds! I had the Mahi Mahi and my man had the Mahi tacos . Super moist fish with rad Quinoa! Steve the manager was great! This place is a bang for your buck! Loved it!
I'm so glad they're open 24 hours to fulfill all my cravings at the end of a long day

Got the nachos which were not bad. Filling and good for 3-4 ppl

Friend got the fried chicken sandwich which he gave a 5/5 (one of the best he's had)

I had the burger which was a solid 4/5 

I would defiantly go back on my next visit.

Food was good. A little more pricey than what I would normally pay for breakfast but because of the hour that I went to eat, I kinda had to deal with it. Had the Brooklyn sandwich with hash browns. The sandwich was huge and I felt I was eating 4 or 5 Breakfast Jacks. The hash browns were not crispy. If you like them crispy, let the waiter know.
My waiter was a little creepy. Just caught this weird vibe. He kept hovering and asking me if everything was ok and stuff. Used to people checking on me once after delivering food but not more than that. Perhaps because there were only 3 tables occupied he didn't know what else to do.
 I'm not sure I would eat there again. Maybe I'll go walk to a nearby hotel to find something a little cheaper. Food was good but after tip, $30 for a breakfast sandwich was a little much.

No real wait at the front for a somewhat late lunch (unlike the 20+ minute wait quoted for breakfast at Monte Carlo's Pub which was half empty/closed off).

Since I had only consumed a protein shake and was starving, and was planning on a late after-show dinner, I decided to get something that would "stick" with me: Pasta!  The chicken carbonara mac and cheese had perfectly al dente penne pasta along with a fantastic cream sauce, just enough cheese, and large pieces of crispy bacon and moist chicken breast pieces.  It was an excellent meal.

Their soup is only sold by the bowl, not by the cup, which was disappointing.  Also disappointing to a family member was their lack of Eggs Benedict on the abbreviated all-day breakfast section.  But the do give out condiments in tiny little glass bottles and jars!

Our waiter did keep vanishing for long periods of time, so it was very difficult to order additional items or get refills.  Hence only 4 stars.

The prices made me go a little wide-eyed, but I wasn't paying, so I didn't really consider it.
If you are looking for a terrible 6 dollar breakfast that will cost you 50 dollars, then this is your place!

This is one of the best restaurant in Vegas! Quality and service rival the strip but at a lot lower price point.
We had the Salmon and who knew Raspberry paired with it. Awesome!
Short ribs better than some I had in LA. 
Don't miss this place.

We ate breakfast here every day of our stay because of the convenience, service & all around good food. We were lucky every time we arrived as we were seated within a few minutes each visit.

Their eggs benedict was my favorite. Crispy, light, fluffy English muffin topped with ham, perfectly poached egg & hollandaise. Annnd perfectly cooked hash browns! Yum-O! I did try the lox & bagel & was very underwhelmed. So much so that I stopped eating & picked from H's plate. The OJ was very fresh, cold & delicious & the coffee some of the best I've had in Vegas. 

The staff was phenomenal! Very attentive even though they were packed & very friendly. So while Caesar's closed my favorite breakfast café, this is a nice alternative.

This place is ok. If you want perfectly mediocre food it's the place!
The classic breakfast was ok
The turkey club sandwich was really good!
However - the Caesar salad was horrible. I have never had one I didn't like. Ever.

Brian was our waiter and he was nice.
Eddie at the bar is will make your night-too funny! The food is great-I had the Latino Vegan Ouinoa! The outside Patio has like 10 TV's git to watch the Warriors continue their Streak!

first off--great service. the staff is seasoned and friendly.  they take care of you.
nice setting. 

food surprisingly good. held to a caesars palace level of very good standards.
pancakes are not the best i've ever had, but they're pretty darn good. esp with the beautiful bottle of syrup. i went back and ordered it twice.  
not a big fan of the texture of their breakfast sausages, but bacon is reliable.

yes, it's hotel pricing. but overall, if i'm stuck in caesars, this is a decent option.

This place was so delicious! Had breakfast here a couple weeks ago and I'd go back! parking is pretty rough since the restaurant is in the front of the hotel but it's so worth the walk!!! Wish I lived in Vegas. I'd have breakfast here every weekend ! Not kidding.

This is a really nice place to grab lunch on the strip.  Very well decorated and comfortable inside.  Cool and very clean.  Portions (burgers, fries, etc) were HUGE.   Food tasted superb (LA Burger).  Service was pleasant and attentive.  Prefer coke over pepsi but but that's more of a Caesar's thing.  Well done, Cafe Americano!

My friends and I were HANGRY on a Friday night so we stopped in this restaurant while walking through Caesars (it had no crowds, no lines, no wait). This place does not come close to any of the great restaurants in the area, but the price does not reflect that. We paid for mediocre, overpriced burgers and pastas which was a huge disappointment. Will not be back.

In hindsight, we should have toughened up and took our money elsewhere.
Though we only stopped here for some drinks the service was really good. The bartenders were cool and friendly.

Great, accessible, 24-hour place. I am a sucker for breakfast food so I tried both this place and Cafe Bellagio. This place wins, easily.

First of all, it is ever-so-slightly cheaper than Cafe Bellagio (okay, $1-$2 isn't much, but still). Don't get me wrong, I don't eat or drink at places like Caeser's Palace and Bellagio to save money, but it is still an indicative factor.

Second, hash browns, much better than CB, smaller portion, BUT- you also get toast. At CB toast was a separate side item, cost extra. What.

Third, the toast comes unbuttered so you can portion the butter yourself. Thank you! More places need to do this!

Fourth, the service, once seated, was phenomenal. I believe I was helped by Ryan K, at least that's what is on my receipt, and he was prompt, courteous, professional, and checked back often to ensure I had everything I needed. More servers need to do this!

Getting seated, however, was disastrous. It wasn't even busy. Lots of open tables, but for each group in line they were setting up tables ad-hoc. Maybe I came right after a huge rush left? I don't know, I'm not docking any stars for this - I just felt for being third in line, that the wait was kind of laughable.

Will definitely be back.

Had breakfast here. This is what replaced Central at Caesars Palace, and is located just around the corner from the hotel lobby. Service was good and prompt. They have good coffee and a good juice selection, though it's a pricey juice at $7 for a small glass. Had a Crab Cake Eggs Benedict. Overall, the dish was good. English muffin perfectly toasted, eggs perfectly poached, and hollandaise sauce was great. However, the crab cakes could've used a little more crab and a little less bread so I was a little underwhelmed having previously lived in Maryland where there's a very high standard for crab cakes. The meal came with breakfast potatoes, which were good. Overall, this is a great place to come for breakfast.

We had dinner here one night and it was amazing. The Asian chicken salad is awesome, and the pizza is out of this world. We would have eaten there more often, however just like everything else at Caesars, it's overpriced. $20+ for a BLT. No thanks.
Saul is the most awesome waiter. He was super accommodating for our big party. The food was fabulous!  We had a great time and completely enjoyed our time here.

Walked in just for a late/early snack at 4:00am because only place open, came out  with amazing experience, starting from amazing food, awesome service by Daniel he was on point, anything we needed he took care of us, also management by Carlos is fantastic! Couldn't ask more from the place or employees if you have time make shure to stop by even if you're not staying at Ceasers palace!
The food was great, but too pricey. We asked for one extra English muffin and we were charged 9 dollars only for that.

Ordered breakfast. the portions are huge. The corn beef hash is a little on the greasy side but delicious. Order poached eggs rather than scrambled with corn beef. The bagel salmon combo was also good.

Checked into the hotel at 4am and we were looking for a quick bite to eat in the hotel.  We went here because it was open.  Ordered a vegetarian pizza, $19 for a small size, and a cup of clam chowder, $17.  Three small bottled waters were $9.  The food was ok and was totally over priced.  Bartender acted like we were bothering him by ordering to go.

I've been here a few times for breakfast.  I've had their rib hash which i remember being a huge portion. I really like their breakfast burrito, its so delicious,  just the right amount of chorizo which if its too much i get too much chorizo flavor if that makes sense. The prices are a little high, you can expect to pay about $25-30 on 1meal plus drink and tip. 


I'll will definitely keep coming back
This place is a huge disappointment. You think you would get some class in Las Vegas....

A must-go-to!...the staff (friendly, energetic, like family by the time you leave), the food (big portions, reasonably priced, especially for vegas, atmosphere (outside the Caesars Palace entrance with incredible views of the strip, can even hear the Bellagio fountains dance, good music and tvs all around the bar). I would HIGHLY RECOMMEND!!!

Visited this spot twice while staying at Caesars. Breakfast wasn't very good and was very expensive. The prices are a bit over the top for diner type food. However, the food does taste fresh and hits the spot. Breakfast wrap had too much arugula, not Enough eggs. The hash browns were cooked well. The portions are at least very large- great for sharing! Wouldn't come back for breakfast, but I would recommend lunch, casual dinner or post drinking grub. The burger and fries were excellent and the Mac n cheese very delicious. If the prices were less I would be more inclined to eat here. These prices are higher than any other casino diner I've been to in vegas. Don't come out of your way to eat here, but it's convenient if staying at Caesars.

The food was great.  Servers were very nice!   The only thing I would warn about is the cost of food!   It is on the expensive side...But I'm ok with paying the extra money if the food is great!   We may try again for dinner.

The food here is ok.  I mean it's not terrible, but for the price, I expect outstanding.  I had the All American Breakfast which is eggs, bacon, potatoes and toast for $22.  That's a little much for just an average breakfast.  Hubby had a Three Meat omelet w/hash browns and toast for $25.  I thought the hash browns were the best part, but still not worth the money.

The staff is really nice and attentive, but I could get the same quality food for much cheaper.  I think you pay a pretty penny since it's located in Caesar's.  We've had great meals at Caesar's and we are fine to pay high prices, as long as the food is worth it.  It just wasn't worth it to me.

It's difficult to rate this place accurately as the service is slow and unfriendly, however, the food is pretty good. It is over-priced and underwhelming.  

It's most redeeming factors are that it's open 24 hours, and has a limited number of Vegan menu items.  

I have been here on several occasions, and have always found the servers on the less enthusiastic end of the scale. My most recent visit was the worst ever.  

When I arrived I told the hostess I just wanted to order something quick to go and take up to my hotel room.  She instructed me to go to the bar and order from one of the bartenders.  As I approached the first bartender, he stated "I'm off the clock, go see him" as he pointed to the opposite end of the bar.  I walked down to that employee, and he said, "please go see the other bartenders, I'm very backed up helping the servers."   I went to a third bartender back on the opposite end of the bar, and he directed me back to the first, that was off the clock.  After the five minute runaround, i walked out. 

Still hungry, about two hours later, I returned and asked to be seated at a regular dining table. Service was still as slow as I expected it would be, but the food was pretty good.  

Lower you expectations, which I've done, and life will be good.

So tasty! Went here before a show and got the burger and a vodka cran! 

Tasty!

Boyfriend got the bbq chicken. Large portions but so good!!!!!!!

We were looking forward to our light dinner at this cafe today, but the choice was not a good one. We ordered two entres the first was a salad with avacado, greens, and chicken.  The greens were stale and the chicken was hard as a thief's head.  The second entres was their breakfast item steak and eggs.  The steak was described as ribeye, but its name was the only relationship with it and a ribeye steak as we have come to enjoy.  It was tough and contained gristle.  The eggs were ordered over medium and were served nearly uncooked.  Bottom line we cannot recommend this restaurant and are surprised it survives as a companion to Caesars hospitality. PS the price was $65.00 before tax.

Pretty good food at this location and situated close to the Absinthe show which is the reason why we ate here. Great service although prices are a little steep e.g $16 for a glass of house Cabernet and around $45 for steak and eggs (although the steak was really good)

In the heart of the palace, and 24/7 make it easy and convenient to crash there anytime f the night for a good food! And they serve breakfast at night too! Amazing! 
The only negative point of this place was it takes too long to serve the food.
I tried La burger it has avocado and kale with a delicious sauce  , its a bit spicy due to the jalapino  on it.

Sit at the bar - great for people watching in the lobby. We split the Asian salad - fresh and delightful. Drinks are over-priced. Service was slow. With so many options in Vegas, not sure why drinks are so over-priced and service can be so lousy.

Awesome and friendly service. Robbie was very nice and friendly. Unlike the guys at the balagio who are very serious and don't even smile. Luis also served us and he was very nice and friendly as well

It's my first and last time the place is good clean everything is good except the server Jessica young is mean disrespectful have attitude and races she didn't even ask us what we want we were sitting for 25 minutes when I ask about the manager he was so nice but she is still bitching even after he talked to her and told her to help us she still didn't help I don't think she should be here propably go find a job where she doesnt comunicate with people or send her to the kitchen to wash dishes  then they send us a nice guy called Jonathan he was great but still I'm gonna give the 1 star because of that B Jessica Young

Came for breakfast and it was amazing!!! Pricey definitely, but well worth it!! They have different type of dishes than what is normally at breakfast places but I highly recommend trying it if you are in the area

24 hours a day?!! How cool is that. Right in the middle of the lobby. Superbe location. The bar seats on the inside and out for best access and people watching. I was able to catch a quick snack or meal with my friends. The food was well made and tasty. Fresh and appealing. Homemade guacamole. Thick tomato slices. Perfect pizza with custom ingredients. I really appreciated the staff for their genuine hospitality and willingness to add sides when we wanted a little something extra. Great in every way.

We ran into this place by accident after a Plain White T's show. Thank God we did. Food was amazing.  The short rib nachos on the appetizers menu is to die for. Sooooo good!!! The staff here is very good, we had Jessica Y, feels like we have known her for years. Very personable. I highly recommend this place.

(Disclaimer: Food consumed while highly intoxicated.) 

It's 2:30 AM & my friend and I were walking down the strip when we smelled bacon. We followed our noses into Caesar's Palace and found Cafe Americano. We both ordered their All-American Breakfast ($20). Their bacon was not a disappointment. I had to stifle my urges to scream because I was so happy with their bacon. It was a big portion, so I couldn't finish it. Took home leftovers and ate it again 6 hours later--  potatoes were STILL delicious, even when I ate it cold. Only strange thing was that we had so many different people serving us, I wasn't quite sure who our waiter was. (Maybe this is due partially to my intoxication) anyway we had to ask twice for ketchup but it might've been because we asked the wrong person for ketchup the first time. 
Summary:

1. Food is overpriced. Welcome to Vegas.
2. Breakfast is delicious.
3. Bacon.

My only 4 stars is the short rib nachos.
I'm a frequent visitor of Caesars Palace every quarter of the year, and the restaurant is just a more expensive option in general. Food and service is fine, but I don't recommend unless you are too tired/lazy to seek out other options.

The pizza was really good and so was our waiter. I'm giving it a 2 star for the fact that they seated us next to a table of 4 drunk spoiled young "adults". It was 10pm and the place wasn't that crowded. The sad thing is the staff did nothing to quiet then while they yelled dropped the F bomb repeatedly drawing attention from all around us.

We went here on a Friday at 8pm. We got seated at a dirty table where the people were barley getting up from their meal. The place was dead and I should have taken that as a sign. We placed our order for drinks and dinner at the same time. It took 20 MINUTES for a glass of champagne and a margarita. When the bar was so slow. Our server was trying too hard to make it sound funny it took so long which was something we were not happy about. It took a while

I am going to come out right away and say the Cafe Americano's food and service is solid for a lobby restaurant, significantly better than its predecessors Central and Augustus Cafe.

I understand the nature of commerce. This is a prime space in the most iconic hotel in the world. Im not cheap and we spend a shitload on our Vegas trip.

$6.00 for fountain drink
$15. 00 for bread pudding dessert
$24 for Pulled pork sandwich and small portion fries
$19 for 4 whole chicken wings split in half.

That is greed at its finest. Even for Vegas standards, its an obscene joke.
Well on the pricey side, this is extremely convenient when you're staying in Caesar's hotel. My son and I enjoyed it very much. We will return to this café the next time we stayed in Caesars Palace.

First time eating here...food is a bit pricey $20 for a burger and fries. Don't get me wrong the burger was huge and delicious. However, I was disappointed in the service given that it is located inside of Ceasar's Palace. The server acknowledged us after being sat at our table. He did not return to ask how our food was or if we needed anything else.  They got my husband's order wrong. I probably will not return.

Don't use your debit or credit card here. Pay with cash. Most likely someone there is using a credit card or debit card reader to save or steal account numbers. I've gone there twice on two seperate occasions both several months apart. Both times the only time I ever used my debit or credit card was at this place only to order drinks as usually everything else including dinner and hotel were being charged to a master account for the company I work for. Both times I've come back home to San Diego only to about a week or so later get a call from my bank that my debit or credit card was being used in Las Vegas at Chucky Cheese and some Waffle House. Oh let's not forget Frys Hardware for $400. Then there was also the gas station. The bank asked me to recall where I've used my cards on these seperate instances and it's only ever been at Cafe Americano so I put two and two together. Highly unlikely that it's mere coincidence that both times I've gone to Vegas my info gets stolen out of thin air. You've been warned! Cafe Americano please look into your POS systems. Something is going on and I can only imagine how many people have repeated fraud on their bank for coming here. I'm only giving one star here because there was a very attentive waiter on the patio bar so service was good but besides that I'll never not pay with cash here

The 24 hour diner at Caesars Palace...and keeping in tune with everything Caesars, the food is pricey but above average portions.  I had a breakfast burrito and the waiter asked me if I wanted jalapenos and responded that I did.  Breakfast went well, lots of coffee but the bill reflected a $2 charge for the jalapenos.  My bad as I should've checked first.  

Had a nighttime snack and drinks before bed and they do serve Tito's in the bar and no where else in the casino.  Took a few minutes for the bartender to acknowledge us but maybe he thought we were just trying to get free jalapenos.  Good food but again a bit on the higher side.

Would recommend but check if jalapenos are free or not.
Great breakfast! Fruit platter was beautiful and delicious! Keith was our waiter and he was by far the best waiter in Vegas! We will be back just to see him.

I would highly advise not dining at Cafe Americano's patio. Our server, Allison, was fantastic but was setup for failure by her manager. She was the only waitress for the entire patio and received absolutely no help from the bartenders at the empty outdoor bar or manager. It took us over an hour to get a drink even though we could see our bottle of Rosè sitting on the bar while the bartender did not lift a finger. After speaking to the manager about our experience he promised that he would be checking on us to make sure the rest of our dining experience went off without a hitch. He was never to be seen again.

The food was good though!
Great food - especially the pizza!!! Pricey food, but it's 24 hours, so it's there when you need it the most.
Very convenient, next to Starbucks inside Ceasers Palace. Great food and excellent service.

I did not intend to come here but rather found a friend who had wandered in after a night on the town.  I didn't order food bc of the hastiness of my situation and the price (omg everything is so expensive), but I did have the rest of my friends pancakes which I must say were amazing!  The service was also incredible even though I was just having water.  The waitress was very attentive.  The atmosphere, for a side hotel restaurant that's open 24 hours was very inviting and upscale in nature.  Idk about the other hours of the day but at 2:30am, this place was on point.

My husband and I had a $100 food credit from Caesars Palace so we chose this place. It's a 24-hour restaurant located inside of Caesars Palace Hotel. The prices were reasonable, they were not super outrageous like some Hotel restaurants can be. My pizza was amazing and the wings and fries were good too. Mind you we have been partying for about 3 nights so anything probably would have taste good. Lol jk

Luis our waiter was amazing! We stopped by at 4am after leaving the club. Even though it was 4am Luis had a great attitude and was very helpful. He made a great suggestion, he told us to try the "Short rib nachos." These nachos are the best nachos I've had in a long time. Everything was delicious on these nachos. The chips were perfection. Even though it's an appetizer it's a generous portion. My boyfriend and I were happily full by the time we finished the nachos. So remember if you come during their "Late Night" hours DEFINITELY get the short rib nachos. I promise you won't regret it. Thanks again Luis! You made us feel very welcomed on our first visit to Cafe Americana.
Ask for Saul! He's the best waiter and will treat you like family!! He accommodated our large group of 14 with grace and expertise!!

I had a lovely waitress who was super sweet. I think she is what left an impression on me. The food was ok. It wasn't memorable and if not for the waitress I wouldn't have bothered to write this review. The food wasn't bad, but, it just wasn't as good as the other places that Las Vegas has to offer.
Love this place, if you like chicken then you need to try chicken sandwich, always a lot of people there, they have full bar and nice cocktails.

Although there are many options in Vegas and at Caesars palace to pick from.  I always gravitate towards Cafe Americano.  

Last month my husband and I stayed at Caesars for a week and came here several times.   Even when it was too late to get a table (middle of the night), I was able to order food at the bar or to take to the room.

The fried green tomatoes are the best!  If you love chicken, you have to order the roasted chicken breast.  It takes a bit long since they prepare it when you order.  I don't like breast meat but not in this case.  It was perfectly spiced, tender and perfectly roasted.   It was plated with roasted potatoes and asparagus.   I literally kept telling all my friends to go try this chicken at Cafe Americano.   Yeah, that good!  No...better than that!!!

If the prices were a little bit cheaper, I would give this place 5 stars.  It is in Caesars Palace, so everything is expensive so maybe I shouldn't give them one less star over it but I feel like I have to. We had a burger and fries that we picked up to go one night and then we picked up some a la cart breakfast menu items the morning we were leaving.  The food was surprisingly good both times.  Granted, you are paying a lot for it so you would expect it to be good but it was still better than I had expected.  They were also very fast and the staff was very friendly and helpful.

After running through various options for breakfast, we came here because of convenience. We were staying in the Augustus tower. The menu has pretty much your standard breakfast options.

WHAT I ORDERED:

Dirty bloody mary (extra spicy) - I was pretty impressed!

Huevos Rancheros - loved everything about this plate! The sausage was a bit salty but the beans were surprisingly good! Very flavorful. I'm not even a bean person!

Just those 2 items alone ran me about $50. Pretty steep especially for breakfast. It was good but nothing different than any other brunch spot that will cost you a fraction of the price.

The ambiance was great but the food took forever, was served very cold and they upcharged each person us $9 a person to add one meatball (yes ONE) to a very small portion of pasta. Extremely disappointed and will not be returning.
Breakfast food was good but a little overpriced at $76 for two people. You get a lot of food that you cant finish.

As many of the other reviews have mentioned, great place to people watch. 

The food itself is mediocre and extremely pricey for what you get. I ordered the chicken tenders, they were pretty average but they were for a whopping $18. Most of the menu items were selling at a 50% to a %100% markup from their average prices. However, the quality wasn't even close to being that.

The place itself is nice... with great atmosphere and service. If price isn't an issue, then have a nice casual experience here. However, if price is a factor then I would recommend this place.

Really nice 24 hour place though ! Fancier than most of the other food places that would be open late.

Staying in the hotel and debated between this place and the buffet for breakfast. I ended up incorrectly thinking that Americano would be the bargain. 

That said, my Brooklyn Breakfast Sandwich was perhaps the most delicious egg/bacon/cheese sandwich I've ever eaten. The eggy bun was very delicious, tasty and very fresh.

I was at the bar and service was great. The coffee was good and strong, but a bit lukewarm. The only food related blip in my experience. 

The sandwich was huge so I was able to take half away for a late morning snack. However it plus a cup of coffee, tax and tip got me to $36. 

The buffet was $38 and no doubt had fruit and other nice breakfast options. Probably a better split of both decadent and healthy food.

Glad I tried it, but may go buffet next time I eat breakfast inside the hotel.

This place is so convenient, it's open 24 hours a day, so it's great when you want to eat something and you can't find anywhere open. The area is huge and has cute trees with lights inside. I ordered the pepperoni pizza and it was pretty good. Overall pretty satisfied.

We ate breakfast here for valentine's day and it was delicious! We got sat really quickly and did not wait long for the server either. We ate the huevos rancheros and steak and eggs with a side of a bagel with cream cheese. They were both amazing. The huevos rancheros had tortillas on the bottom with beans, salsa and your choice of eggs on top with a side of hash.  It was not spicy at all but full of flavor. My bf picked the steak and eggs skillet but was given a different steak and eggs. Still it was good, over cooked but still enjoyed it. We would definitely be back either way.

Overrated, overpriced 

Passed by this spot a couple of times when in Vegas. Decided to try it for a late breakfast. They told me they were not serving breakfast anymore but I could still order some eggs and toast. Well, 2 fried eggs and 3 slices of cheap white bread.... Payed $14 bucks ($8 for 2 fried eggs and $6 for some piece of cheap looking and tasting white bread), not counting on tip and taxes! Insane! Ended up paying around $20. 
In general the staff is nice and the location is good but....pricey pricey pricey for what they have to offer..

I had the most unpleasant experience meeting Ryan K. and his crappy attitude. Apparently we made the mistake of ordering a few hot chocolates and he was less than thrilled. Our order was responded with a sarcastic "Great, just how I would like to end my night, by making hot chocolate." The passive aggressiveness continued with a unnecessary attitude towards us and ended with a "Come back and visit when you are ready to have some cocktails." It was just completely rude and uncalled for. So I guess don't go if you plan to order anything that isn't alcohol.

Stopped by Cafe Americano for a breakfast after early arrival to Las Vegas. 

Cafe Americano located right by the main entrance to Caesars Palace casino and it is open 24 hours. The menu is reasonably concise and makes selection easy. I had traditional Eggs Benedict, which was served with the potato hash. Hash was perfectly crispy and very well seasoned (this is not always the case -I'm sure you can relate to that). The eggs were just a touch overlooked, and would wish for Hollandaise sauce pour to be a bit more generous, but overall it was quite tasty dish (I'm somewhat nit picking here). 
What I have a problem with is prices - I know it is Las Vegas, but $22 for eggs Benedict is steep (I guess I can live with $5 coffee as it comes with refills). Interestingly enough, pasta dish on dinner menu costs $25 - hard to figure out pricing strategy. 
Well, during the late night, this might be your only option anyway...

Food is delicious and the patio IS dog friendly. I emailed the restaurant and got a response it was. Since you're in Caesars Palace expect it to be on the more expensive side but totally worth it. I was there for taco Tuesday/FIFA game and the drink specials and food specials were on point. I even had my small dog in a carrier next to my feet and there were no issues since it was so hot outside. I'd recommend. Staff was friendly, drinks were always filled, and the service was quick.

Food Quality - 4 stars
Service - 5 stars
Value for food -2 stars

This reataurant is conveniently located inside Cesars right by checkin desk. We ate here twice in 24 hours and I decided to write the review after trying it twice. First was last night. We got there right after 11 and the menu had changed to late night. We
ordered the sliders and the mac and cheese. Both really good. The service was good too. Biggest problem
is the price. Average price of entree was $20+ per plate. Expect most
items to be twice the price of any similar venue outside the casinos.

The second time we ate there was this morning, we were running late and just checked
out. I ordered a breakfasr burrito and mimosa. Gotta say the mimosa was fantastic. The breakfast burrito was so-so. Again this place is very conveninent if your other options are limited.

I have ate here twice, once for breakfast and this time for dinner. I will always remember two things about it, overpriced and the food isn't that great. It's basically a 24-hour tourist trap. And, it's independently owned so you won't get any Total Rewards credits for eating here. The bill was about $75 (including tip) for one beer and two hamburgers. The hamburgers did come with french fries that were OK. I ordered my burger medium and it came out well done. I only ate half of it. And, seriously when I eat there are maybe two crumbs left on a plate. The service wasn't great either. Overall, save your money and try a different restaurant. There are plenty to choose from in Vegas!
Robbie and Luis make amazing drinks! The espresso martini and the sexy 24 by Luis are perfection. Try it! You won't regret it.

I ate here twice on my recent stay. They have outside and inside seating.  Service is great!  Food can be a bit pricey, but not terrible.  I had the Brooklyn Breakfast Sandwich both times.  It is HUGE.  Comes with two very large pieces of bacon, cheese, ham and huge egg patties, as well as a side of homefries or hashbrowns.  If you're hungry, this sandwich won't disappoint.  I couldn't finish it the first time I went, but finished it the second time.

This place is located in Caesar's Palace lobby near the check-in desk.

Luis P. was AWESOME!!!! We had THE best service. He was attentive and so fun! He took such good care of us and the food was delicious. He went above and beyond to accommodate our requests and we felt so well taken care of. He is a gem! Thank you for making such a wonderful guest experience. Cheers to you, Luis P.!!!!

Id only come here to wait for a horrible check in process at this hotel. The service is comparable to the hotel in that it was awful. We sat at early afternoon with an almost empty area and the waiter never looked at us. Walked past us and waited on someone who just got there after us. Overpriced short poured wine and a clueless waiter. Maybe the managers should ask you when you leave how it was. Asking at the table is hard to communicate bad service, since your waiter is still trying to serve you. Food was bland, resist the urge to eat here

Only if you are super hungry and need overpriced food should you come here. Definitely over priced Vegas at its best. I would recommend getting an Uber to In N Out since it will cost you the same in the end. As far as burger places on the strip (or near the strip) you can find better elsewhere. Service was reasonably quick and courteous. Miss the old celebrity chef restaurant when I could get a great filet mignon at 2am.

The staff was very friendly and prompt with our order. Ricardo was our server and he it the only reason they get 3 stars. He helped one of our party that is vegan find a great alternative. He really came through. Other than that. The beer is cold but the food is just ok. It doesn't help that it's $20+ for a sandwich that is not above mediocre. It would need to be amazing to justify that.

The first time we came here was on our first trip to Vegas back in February. It was easy because it was inside Ceasars Palace. I'm giving it 4 stars because I remember the horrible experience we had with one of the hostess- she wasn't accommodating or courteous. There were empty tables but they won't sit anyone who isn't a diamond member or something and the line outside was growing. Eventually we were sat but it leaves a bad taste in your mouth when things like this happen. The servers/ waiters on the other hand are simply amazing. They're attentive, respectful, jolly and make amazing suggestions. The portions are really big so sharing is always a good option. They have a nice breakfast selection. But if sweet juice isn't your thing, stay away from the cranberry and grapefruit. I'm not sure if these are from the box or can but they're too sweet for our taste. Their food in general is very good, the burgers in particular  that means a lot especially coming from me since I'm not really into burgers. But you know it's a good one when I finish it and commit to ordering it again next time  the hostesses seem better now that we have returned in December. We saw the rude hostess the other day but that's ok. All in all, it's a good place to enjoy a meal at anytime of the day or night since it's open 24 hours and have a nearby toilets. Price wise, it's up to you if it gets expensive or stay within reason.

Greeted by a rude hostess names Fashka or something close. Didn't smile or greet any guests including us waiting in the VIP line. After a few minutes walked us to a table and the chairs had not been cleaned and had food on them. Edgar the waiter could not answer a question about one of the menu items. Not a great experience. Slow service food ok. Caesar would not be pleased. 


Wow you really are slow. I posted this review 10 months ago and just got a response from the manager in April 2018.
My drink was 15 dollars and tasted watered down. The quality of the food on the dinner menu was not that great especially for the price. However, the shrimp was good and the service was okay.

Ate there last night. Great service and good food. Drinks were pricey, but the Mac & Cheese was $31, and my husband said was just OK tasting. I had the Asian Chicken salad which was delicious and a very generous portion.

Everything was great.  I had the Cuban sandwich.  I would recommend more mustard on it, but that is probably a personal preference.  Braised beef short rib tacos were great.  So many comfort food options on the menu that I would test out many of them.  That is saying a lot considering I am a one dish type person when I find something that I like on a menu.

Everything... yumm. The line was long, but I'm glad we waited. 

There was four of us. The girls ordered Bellinis. Delish! I totally recommend that. And for food we got the short rib nachos, short rib tacos, lobster raviolis and blackened mahi tacos. Everything was so good. Nachos were massive. Everything with the tacos were cooked to perfection. 

I feel our waiter could've been a little more tentative. But then the power went out in the whole casino so I felt back for him after. 

I will return again. And I do recommend this place. I do wish we were able to get breakfast.

This place was a great convenient location for me & my hubby to get a quick bite to eat before we headed out for the night on the town. We had the quesadillas and the guacamole to share together. Guacamole had a really great flavor and came with chips. The quesadilla was an excellent munchy option, it had chicken and jalapeños! Overall I recommend this place and make sure that you tip your server as they do provide great service.
Avoid for breakfast. Poorly prepared, and outrageously high prices for poor quality and basic food. Couldn't even get a decent cup of coffee.

Bad food. Felt like a child cooked my meal.. Nothing was fresh. Extremely slow service and the prices are high for no reason.  
Don't go there if you are in to good fresh food.

Cafe Americano is the best place to eat, drink and have a good time. The food is great with huge portions and the service is excellent!! I ordered the BLT sandwich and it came on very think sourdough bread, with thick pieces of savory bacon. With me being a man with a hefty appetite, I'm more than pleased with the portion of food.
All of the bartenders bring life into the place with their fantastic social skills to their need to please the customer. My bartender, Courtney N., gave high fives to all of her customers and brought a family element to the establishment. 
A fantastic culture has been created at Cafe Americano. Everyone should give it a try.

What a horrible experience we received this morning. Based on the bartenders treatment I can't really say how their food and drinks taste. My friends and I went into this establishment at 3 am we had just came in from out of town and were excited to have our first drink. We sat down and were reading the menu that was on the bartop. We were deciding on which drinks to order. I noticed the bartender busy pouring Hennessy, he then walked over to the guests next to us and he didn't make eye contact. I tried making eye contact with him he ignored my friends and I. It was about 3:15 so I just explained to my friends that he was busy and he would get be right with us. He didn't acknowledge us or make any time of effort to talk to us at any point of our visit. Then two gentlemen walk to the bartop and sat right next to us and he immediately served him that's when we got upset. We left at 3:33 am that's how long we waited for service. I recorded him so management can take action on his discriminative behavior. He definitely needs to be trained on hospitality and how racism and discrimination isn't part of the service industry. His lack of hospitality was vividly demonstrated last night, I'm sure this wasn't the first time he has done this. I work in the service industry and I know exactly what he was doing. He was picking and choosing who he was wanted to serve. I wouldn't want for anyone else to experience such discrimination. I would hope management will take my post seriously and have a conversation with him. **It won't let me post the video however if management will like to view it you may contact me.

We were seated immediately upon entering. Staff was very welcoming and friendly. I ordered the chicken salad. Chicken was dry and over cooked and overpriced. I'd skip this restaurant and try one of the many other places around.

This place was just okay. We went to the 8PM show over at Absinthe (totally recommended!!) and then were looking for a quick bite to eat. Enter Cafe Americano, which was right outside the door and advertised being a 24-hr place. We decided to grab a seat on the patio, so we could share a hookah while we hung out. The price was pretty steep (like $40 if I remember right... about 3x a normal place, but hey, it's Vegas, so I get it), and we went for the apple+mint combo, which to be fair, was great. I ordered a glass of prosecco that was absolutely flat when I got it.. The fish and chips I had were delicious, but the breading on the fish was REALLY heavy. I'm not sure I'd order it again because it was a bit much for me. 

About an hour into our evening, they began shutting the patio down. The hookah (understandably) can't be moved inside, so we had to finish up and get on our way. All in all, it's a fine place to stop if there's not much else open. Our check was split 3 ways and for the items I've described here, I paid about $70. It was the most expensive meal I had in Vegas and probably one of the least impressive. To be fair, though, it included hookah, which was kind of a fun experience.
real solid breakfast on the strip. There chorizo dish had some real flavor to it but you cant go wrong the pancakes.

Came in here at 4am, they had a really limited menu which is understandable but I was really hoping to get some breakfast before heading out for my 6am flight. So I ended up getting just an apple juice before even realizing there was no breakfast and they charged me still. One cranberry one apple for $19. And no food. Not even spiked apple juice, literally just a small glass apple juice.
Had nachos and grilled chicken. Tasty food. Atmosphere is LOUD hard to hear both inside and outside of venue. The food service was quick enough but waitress was phoning it in

Delicious eggs Benedict for breakfast. The fruit cup was amazing with pomegranate seeds, blueberries, and blackberries! Eric S. was our server and took great care of us making sure our breakfast experience was awesome on our last day in Vegas.

Open 24 hours, convenient location inside Caesars, pricey, macaroni and cheese with way too many bread crumbs and a super thick alfredo sauce and dry chicken was $32, service was good, $1 off for Total Rewards members.

Took the server 15minutes to come to us. Shockingly overpriced. Got our order wrong. Gave us stone cold fries. The pizza and chopped salad were ok, nothing special. We also came here the night before for ONE piece of grilled chicken takeaway for our dog, and it took about 30 minutes or more.

I like the Caesars property and play here and stay here but this cafe just makes everything miserable and makes me want to stay at another property.   This is the only cafe really close to the registration and Augustus and Octavia towers so unless you want to hike a bit, you're stuck here for convenience but be prepared to wait forever for a table even though there are tons of tables that are available.  I never understand it.  The two girls at the front are on a power trip because they can seat people how they want and they give attitude unless they like you.  Maybe they expect bribe money for a quicker table.  The atmosphere is nice and the servers are ok.  It is overpriced but that is expected inside the hotel.   For the Price you expect exemplary service and courtesy and professionalism which you will not get here, not even close.  Be prepare to wait again after you are seated like 15 more minutes before you get your food.  Save yourself time and money and go anywhere else for food, and if you don't like hiking for breakfast, then you have to stay at another hotel too.

UPDATE:  I am a 7 stars member, and it didn't make a lick of difference.

This place is definitely not worth the money! We just spent $85 on breakfast for two and it was very underwhelming. I don't mind spending money on food when it is good, but this left a lot to be desired. 

We ordered the eggs Benedict and the veggie hash. If you want food that is worth the cost, do not go here.

This place had terrible service. The managers mom was sitting on the table next to us. They not only ignored us, but our food came out before our drinks. The food was cold too. Wings were under cooked. Cesar salad wasn't even mixed properly, beer came with hair in it. Not even an apology. Stay away

My last day at Caesar's, my family and I ate here for brunch. We ordered the American breakfast plate, breakfast burrito and fruit platter. The portion sizes were so big! The breakfast burrito was really good, along with the breakfast plate. The reason why I rated 3-stars is because of the quality of attention given to food served. The fruit platter looked amazing from the table next to us, but ours didn't look as fresh and it wasn't. The watermelon looked as if it had been frozen and melon looked a little dried. In addition, the grapes were moldy! When we pointed this out, we were discounted merely $5. For those of you that don't know, one moldy grape usually means the other grapes alongside it aren't good either. If the grapes were next to other fruit, the possibility of the other fruit being bad are higher and restaurants are advised to get rid of them. If you find a moldy slice of bread, you don't throw that ONE out and try to eat the others. You throw the whole bag away. Cute cafe, good food for the most part, but quality definitely matters.

Why do they have to overprice such bad food ? At least serve decent food if you are charging $130 for a breakfast for 4 people. I'll rather make my eggs  in the sun on the asphalt than dining here again.

Compared to other places in Vegas, they lack customer service skills; long time waiting for someone to seat us, waiter was nonchalant, appetizers took forever, etc. 

Staff needs more training

We went to Cafe Americano for breakfast on a Monday morning. We'd tried to get in the morning before but there was an hour wait so we made reservations for the next morning of our stay. Caesars Palace has very few options for breakfast. I'm not sure why one of the other umpteen restaurants at Caesars doesn't host breakfast. We enjoyed Cafe Americano. Portions were much too large for us and while some might find that a plus, but it feels wasteful to us. Our waiter was attentive. The food delicious. My bf enjoyed the pancakes and I had the classic eggs Benedict. Would've been nice to have a piece of fruit on the plate. Coffee was good.

Magic eggs is right.....Giving it one star and here is why.  Service was fairly good but the prices and nickel and dime crap was outrageous.  $70 breakfast...one omelette, one eggs Benedict, an OJ, and a coffee.  Are they out of their minds?!?!  There was nothing special about it, as for the OJ, it was 1 cup exactly....how do I know???? They brought it to me in a mason jar that had the measurements on the side!  Coffee wasn't impressive, nothing about this place screamed....hell ya fuck ya....it was more like....congrats, you have survived, and if I had known that, I would have hopped a cabby outta there and gone someplace worth my money...and probably would have been cheaper with a taxi ride.  Dine at a risk to being robbed by the check

Service took very long to get our food out, but they were definitely very quick to clean up our empty plates and keeping our water glasses full. 

I would consider this very pricey for the amount of food for the price and taste, as many seemingly simple dishes were upwards of $24 a plate.

I got a box menu, which is a choice of two items on a designated menu. I chose the quinoa salad and the Cubano sandwich.
The salad was mediocre at best, as it was very bland and lacking in depth and flavor. On the other hand, the cubano was crazy salty (and also made without mustard!) and dry. One bite is all it took to lose the integrity of the skin on the roof of my mouth. 

My brother ordered "The Best Fried Chicken", which was not quite as great as the name suggests. It was reported to be "bleh" and dry. 

Needless to say, we are going to venture out for some more food after this. So much hunger still.

We ordered spaghetti and meatballs and it was absolutely delicious! I loved the sauce. You get one meatball but it is HUGE and delicious. I wish I took a picture of the meatball. The spaghetti and meatball dinner was quite expensive at $26.00 (no soup, salad or bread included) but that's Caesars and I don't mind paying if the food and service is excellent which it was. We also ate breakfast here; the All American Breakfast ($22.00!) included eggs, potatoes, toast and choice of bacon, sausage or ham. It was good and fresh. This restaurant is very pleasant and has an upscale feel to it.
Had a late night bite of ceviche. It was mediocre but the service was good and fast. Good for a late night snack.

I came late at night so maybe that was my problem. Restaurant pulls you in because its by the lobby. For a "café" it was over priced. So much was over priced that I ended splitting a dish. 25 for breakfast food?

two drunk girls came in with a cigarette and was smoking next to me (who doesn't smoke).
managers came over to move her. much appreciated but my question is how did a cigarette get in by one manager and one host?!

just one of those memories you will only remember for the wrong reason =/

on a positive note the server and mac and cheese made this place 3 stars

We went for breakfast and we got the omelette.
You get to choose every hash or home fries. Both are tasty.
The cafe atmosphere is loud. Cause it's open from both sides. One on a terrace and the other one on the hotel.
First time here absolutely loved it!!! They have very good vegan choices ..5 Stars for Nikki if i had the option i'd give her 10 she's phenomenal..

My mom and I walked around most of the morning and we were pretty hungry by the time we stumbled upon Cafe Americano at Caesars. First we sat at the bar since you can order food there too, but the bartenders were too busy attending to 2 tipsy blondes' needs. So we decided to ask for a table on their outside patio, only to find out later that the menus are different inside vs outside (pretty silly if you ask me). We finally got a table inside and even though the cafe was pretty much empty on a Saturday, the service was nonexistent. Our waitress didn't show up for about 10-15 minutes to get our order. The food was yummy, except for their grilled mahi mahi which was too salty. The skinny flat iron steak fry was very tasty and filling. For the prices they have, they should definitely step up their service game!

I would probably give it a 3.5

We stayed at Caesars for a bachelorette party this weekend and loved Cafe Americano.   Perfect place for grabbing a bite or having a drink.   We hosted my sister's bridal shower on their outdoor patio and it was fantastic!  Thank you for taking care of us!

I really enjoyed this place for breakfast. Service was exceptional. Food was hot when delivered. Portions had to be split because they are huge.  A great place to have breakfast if you are staying at Caesars Palace. Oh, and one more thing: they have glutten free bread!!

Screwed up our order. Twice. Also took 30 min for our dinner, we were 1 of 3 tables. We are staying here at ceases for the week , and it would have been very convenient to come back here, but that will not be happening. Very disappointing.

We stopped in for something light and a few cocktails. Our waiter, Saul, explained his favorites on the menu and gave us time to look over the menu since we've never been there before. We ordered drinks, then he proceeded to talk me out of my drink order. I gave-in to try something different and waited 20 min. Drinks came and this Ginger drink was horrible. I returned it to get my original order and waited another 20 min! We were also talked out of our food order!!! He told us if we don't like it, he gets to eat! It's a win-win situation. We said "we'll try the Quesadilla", he said "the Nachos?"

If you like being up-sold by a car salesman and slow service then this is your place! As more people came in, the slower the service became. We had to call the water boy over to get service and the check. We became irritated with the Sauls scheme. Our $90 ticket for 4 drinks and Nachos could've gone a lot further for better service and authentic food elsewhere.

We've got to the restaurant after a long day of fun and gambling and when myself an my wife got to the restaurant to order something to take to our room we encountered a hostess that did not want to work and told us to order at the bar.
The bar staff, 2 people a guy and a girl were obnoxious and when we've asked about recommendation about food and available draft beers they simply handed out the menus like they could care less.
Caesar Palace or the restaurant owner should choose their staff better.
We've ended up leaving without ordering because they don't deserve anyone's money.
Simply horrible staff!

Delicious breakfast! Classic 2 egg sunny side up and a continental breakfast with lots of fruit and pastries. Easy and convenient place to grab breakfast. Food was really good but high however you know everything is when you step into a casino. We sat at the bar which I believe you get served faster and you can watch the crowd in front of you. Fun fun !

I love that this is open 24 hours a day all day everyday. Even in Vegas sometimes I find the shops and restaurants aren't open long enough for me. We were staying in the Augustus tower which is right next to this restaurant. It was the obvious choice for breakfast. I'm glad I had us head down at 8:30 AM on a Saturday because there was a huge line around 9 AM. We both ordered mimosas and the breakfast sandwich. The sandwich was very filling and so delicious with everything you could want in a breakfast sandwich. We'd definitely eat here again for any meal if we can get a table.

This is one of the main 24 hour dining establishments at Caesar's Palace. I had the pleasure of dining there twice, once for lunch and once for breakfast. Both of my meals were totally delicious. For lunch i had a Reuben Sandwich with homemade chips. The Reuben was more than I could handle. It was huge, just like most of the "over the top" entrees served in Las Vegas. For breakfast I had Eggs Benedict which were also very delicious. Service each time was great and never rushed.
Tayton K. was a great bartender/ server! Very personable and friendly. Would definitely return. The food and drinks were also a great ending to our night. Thank you, cafe americano!
Great food, generous portion sizes, excellent service... All in the front of Caesars. Def try this place!

Eat somewhere else if you value your money.  I ordered the clam chowder. $19 for maybe a cup of liquid, two clams, 4 pieces of potato and some bacon slivers. And a slice of sourdough dripping in oil/ butter, it was hard to tell, it was so greasy. 
I think Caesar's is trying to get out of bankruptcy on this one meal. 
Like Oliver in the Dickens take, "Please Sir, I want more".
Awesome location to people watch while in Vegas! They offer a brunch menu that has reasonable prices for the location within the forum shopes of ceasars casino.

I came here on Saturday night just for hookah. It clearly isn't a popular place for hookah so if that's what you're looking for this is the WORST place to come. Just from walking in we waiting like 15 minutes to get seated as to which the bartender said "oh just seat yourself" when he clearly saw us standing there the whole time. After we sat down it took 20 more minutes to get menus. They only had 14 hookah flavors (which is nothing). They brought out our hookah and the hookah was broken and the manager said "oh yeah I just wrapped tape around it" which clearly means the whole hookah is messed up. Extremely harsh and we asked for another one. Coals cost money if you want them replaced. The whole hookah overall was 40 dollars and I've had better for 15. This place was also crawling with crickets super disgusting. They shouldn't be allowed to have hookah here or even food.
Excellent late night eats! The Cuban sandwich w/ pulled pork, ham, pickles, & fries is massive & deelish. Easily shared between 2 people... Totally worth the $20 price tag!

Amazingly delicious crunchy French toast- tasted like apple pie crumble on thick texas toast. Hubs had the all american, fresh food! Asked if they could get us in and out in 40 min so we could catch our flight and they did it in 30, we recomend for sure!

Has a good experience here. I was tired from traveling and didn't want to expend too much brain power figuring out what to eat so I just went to the lobby and found this place. Amazing service! Water glass always full, perfect pacing, polite and efficient. Manager stopped by to ask how it was going (I always love that!!). I had the all American breakfast and all was delicious and cooked perfectly. My guest has the wedge salad and that was superb was well. Loved the presentation. No issues and a good spot for a wide variety of options.

When you come to Vegas you think that people are going to give you decent service because you are going to be in and out and they'll never see you again.
