Ryan, the bartender here, spent time chatting with us, getting to know us and just having fun which is why we made it a point to come by EVERY night that we were in town. We came here our first night for dinner and really enjoyed all of our food and the service we received. Then we met Ryan and came to the bar every night. His amazing service and awesome personality were the key to our experience. We will come back and visit again because of Ryan and his team.

We decided to go here one morning while in Vegas, because we wanted to enjoy a nicer breakfast (not many big restaurants open other than buffets). 

The ambiance is great, the service is impeccable. My husband ordered the huevos rancheros (not pictured), and I had the eggs benedict garden style with asparagus, roasted tomato, spinach and homefries on the side. 

My eggs benedict were perfectly runny, the greens were a great touch, and it was greatly seasoned on an english muffin. My husband enjoyed the huevos rancheros. 

I will say this place is definitely PRICEY for breakfast. Our bill after tip was $75. So be aware before you take that seat that this will be one of the most expensive breakfasts you'll have.

Ordered the bbq rib rack for about $35. Came with little half filled basket of fries and red cabbage. The rib was super salty. I was only able to finish about 2 out of the 6 ribs. It's sad when the fries are the best item on the plate. 

Other item from group:
Lasagna was best item on table.
Fish and Chip didn't taste good. Bit fishy.
Slow Braised Rib was decent. 

Overall don't this place was worth it. Food wasn't good and place is over priced.

High priced food but not worth the value paid for. I ordered scrambled eggs and sausage links. Eggs were runny and undercooked. Sausage casing was like biting through a rubber band. Cold toast. The worst part? Paying $22 for this poor quality, flavorless meal. $5 for the coffee. Talk about gouging for inferior food. Sent the food back to redo. Absolutely not worth it.

Wife had the Bacon Bacon Biscuit, which was cold in the center. Also the way it was described in the menu did not convey it would be served as a sandwich. They also charged for the salsa. Talk about nickel and diming. Will never return here. Dined here for breakfast on Monday, June 18, 2018.

We ate breakfast the next day at Claim Jumper at Golden Nugget. 100% better for much less money.

Again, we were very disappointed and had the impression since it was Caesars, they would strive for better. Not on this occasion. Will never go back.
The BLT was huge!!! I couldn't finish it but it was great. Our waiter was friendly and checked on us throughout our late night visit. And they are open 24/7 as every place in Vegas should be.
This is the 24/7 restuarant at Cesar's Palace. New menu is much improved. I have only eaten breakfast here but always good and now better. lots of healthy choices.

Overall a GREAT dining experience here last night. 

My family and I were hungry for a late night dinner and we stumbled upon here in Ceasars Palace. Open 24/7 but Very cute set up, a little more on the trendy side and not your normal 24/7 cafe place. 

Our food was delicious. We all got a variety of different things, and they all were great! We had the Octopus Pizza, the Burger, the Breakfast Platter, and the applewood smoked ham and turkey sandwich.

The thing that truly made our visit great was the service from everyone Danielle our waitress- Jonathon- our waiter/bus boy and the Bar Manager Adrian. Everyone was so friendly and great. I would like to especially recognize Jonathon for his above and beyond service to us, even offering us water cups to go since it's hot outside! He was great.

We will definitely be back. I am in the restaurant industry and heard this is their first one on the West Coast- so I truly do wish you all the best of Luck! Continue with the great food and service and you will do well- that's the recipe for success! Thanks again and see you all next time!

We got "late night food" here.. More like 4am after Drai's food. This was the first thing we ran into after Drai's across the street. We had a caesar salad, chicken tenders and an american breakfast. All were delicious and hit the spot! Our server was very sweet and made sure to keep our coffee cup full. We appreciated that so much! I would recommend this restaurant for those who want a late night snack or a quick bite to eat.

Can not critique the food, just the drinks...

Bought a couple of drinks at the bar, while waiting for a show to start. The bar itself is quite elegant and the bar tender was very responsive (did not have to flag one down or stand around with my thumb up my ass). The two drinks we ordered were "healthy" when it came to the alcohol content and they tasted good, but the price set me aback when I was hit with the bill - $28 ($14 apiece). No, Toto, we were not on the boardwalk of the Fremont Experience anymore!

11.15 am on a Sunday and they aren't serving their full breakfast menu. Didn't inform us on the way in either. I'm not sure what kind of cafe stops serving breakfast in the am, especially on the weekend.

We went for brunch, and it was pretty slow- a total of four tables, including us.  Our food was fine and came out promptly...but that's where our service ended! We were never checked on again or offered a refill of water or coffee.  The simple, drip coffee from a coffee pot was $5.50 each, by the way.  I know that we're in Vegas so we should expect higher prices, but we should also be offered a coffee refill!!

Love the breakfast here. Yes, it's expensive but isn't it expensive almost everywhere else on the strip?! At first, I was surprised at the high prices but when the food got into my belly...it made me happy. The corned beef hash was delicious. I'm still day dreaming about it. The yogurt parfait was very good. Waffles were light & good. My mother in law & sis enjoyed breakfast and they also agreed, it was delicious. Service was attentive. I would definitely come back again when I'm at Caesars.

Our waiter gave us great service is the only reason I am giving 2 stars.
Those of you who know me know I am a total "foodie" and the food my Mom & I were served here doesn't warrant a star! 

I am never this harsh but my Fried Chicken Salad promised assorted lettuces and I got chopped up iceberg, the tomatoes, at least the ones I could find, were grape tomatoes cut in half, and there were few small pieces of cucumber AND then the "FRIED" chicken (I expected a sliced fried chicken breast), consisted of small breaded chicken nuggets - seriously! McDonald's probably does a better job on chicken nuggets as these were still slightly frozen in the center. My Mom took one and hers was more frozen in the center than the one I tried.

My Mom's fries were Luke warm and not crisp either. This was a total shame as this was our first meal when we arrived at Caesar's Hotel in Las Vegas
Obviously I would NEVER recommend!

Not good at all. 35.00 for eggs Benedict, coffee and tip. Food was tepid. I know eggs Benedict are hard to keep hot but I feel like I was racing to get them down before hollandaise started congealing. I expect better from a breakfast that carries that kind of price tag. When I told my server that it was cold and hard to cut the bread he brought me a knife. I would rather eat at Starbucks. Not what I want but the price and the food are more palatable.

GLUTEN FREE TOAST WAS FANTASTIC SURPRISE! Fast, efficient, wait was 15 minutes  when loaded with a line. Waiter Noe A = subtle but not pushy, observant, super efficient and friendly with a smile. 

Breakfast seemed pricey, but the 3 meat omelet, excellent, was half a dinner plate,  3" thick and loaded. Hash-browns covered the other half of the plate, cooked perfectly. Big guys, this will fill you up. 

Mango smoothie was tasty and not too sweet. Probably too filling for me along with a huge omelet. I managed to finish the toast, omelet, and smoothie, just had no more room for the hash browns. With no refrigerator in the room, I had to leave them. There really was enough for two people.

People with smaller appetites should ask if they can split the omelet. If you can, this suddenly becomes the best and most affordable breakfast outside of House of Blues for Defcon people, and much closer to the conference. Not sure if they will let you carry out, but that would be amazing.

My friend and I stopped here before our flight leaving Vegas. We loved it so much, we ended up deciding to miss our flight, just so we could stay longer.

First and foremost, the service here is 100%! Luis was super sweet and accommodating--giving us drink suggestions and also phone chargers (because basic white girls and dying phones are a regular problem).

I don't know if it's a compliment or embarrassing to say that we stayed here for about five hours. However, in the course of those five hours, we had (each) 1 Bellini, 1 Bloody Mary, 4 cross between a Moscow Mule and Mint Juleps, and a beer. We also were responsible adults and ate. I opted for the chips and guacamole along with the Blackened Mahi Tacos, while my friend had the AMAZING Clam Chowder. Safe to say all the food was devoured and the drinks were slurped down.

I can't sing the praises of this place enough. We loved it so much that my friend and I decided to stay at Caesar's Palace during our next Vegas visit, just so we can hang out at this bar.

Great breakfast spot!  Kristina and Freddy at the bar are awesome!  Prompt and friendly service and Kristina made a great recommendation for my breakfast.  I would definitely come back to Cafe Americano and sit at the bar with Freddy and Kristina.

We had to go back again the next morning!  They have the most delicious french toast with berries and whipped cream.  They have this amazing aged Bourbon maple syrup to go with it - which seems lighter yet super complimentary to an already sweet dish.

Ate here late at night and the bartender (I think his name was Tray) was AMAZING!!! I have some dietary restrictions and he was so helpful to get me what I could eat even with the limited late night menu. He spent time talking to my group and really took care of us. Great guy!

When you're on the strip, everything is overpriced. Spent the morning at Ceasar's palace and stopped by Cafe Americano on the way out for some brunch. Ordered the American breakfast plate (I think that's what it was called), a mimosa and hubby ordered the huevos rancheros with a green smoothie. Overall, the food is really good. Fresh ingredients for sure. My hubby mentioned the huevos rancheros was one of the best he's ever had, so that definitely says something. My plate was traditional and boring, but it was also very good. 

Walked out spending $80. Expensive for sure. We realize that we could've just went back to our hotel and had the brunch/breakfast buffet for $35. 

With everything else that the strip has to offer, I probably won't be back any time soon.

The only 24h restaurant at Caesars Palace 
Every time I stop by they doing better and better 
Nice patio 
The pizza and the burger are great the staff is really good 
And around midnight the bartenders are just fantastic

I'm not a morning or breakfast person, but with time change, hangover etc. I was up early and hungry every morning at Caesars and checked out Cafe Americano (open 24/7, BTW) first day there, and it was so fabulous I ate there every morning. The first breakfast place that excited me since I was a kid eating at diners on Long Island, so much so that I had to submit this review. If I was still a party animal, I could also see eating there at 4 am after clubbing - but those days are sadly long behind me...

Food awesome. The American breakfast - with the typical eggs (three), meat choices (ham steak thick and succulent), potatoes (incredible crispy thick hash browns or home fries), half dozen toast options, etc was perfect. The huevos rancheros (again three eggs any style and delicious chorizos) with lots of extras including avocado were better that I can find in Dallas where I now live. The plates of French toast, fruit, etc that went by my table looked fresh, authentic and amazing. Coffee just as tasty as Starbucks. 

Ambience bright, open and delightful. Big TVs over bar in case u want to watch games while chowing down (NFL ticket allowed me to watch four games over breakfast on Sunday morning).  Tip, if not watching ball games, ask for table towards rear by windows, unless hangover won't allow u to be near sun!  Also nice outdoor seating. 

Service excellent, too. 

In closing, I can't imagine eating at a breakfast or brunch buffet for two or three times the cost over Cafe Americano if staying at Caesars.
Jon T is the best bartender ever!!!! He makes AMAZING drinks, has great conversation, and is just all around great. If you know what's good for you, you'll just come check him out!
Good food but over priced.  Had the buffalo wings you get 8 in order and they are above average in size for. Hi ken wings.

This is an outstanding 24 hr Cafe. The prices are somewhat high but comparable to the other casino restaurants. Breakfast particularly feels overpriced though. The service is impressive for being a "Cafe". The menu holds a wide variety of options for breakfast, lunch, dinner, or those late night cravings. This place is usually somewhat busy but the bar always has somewhere to sit down and place your order for what seems like quicker service. Your food tends to be ready alot sooner than if u were in the dining room. My #1 suggestion no doubt is the short rib nachos. Unbelievable! Whenever i go i just can't pass up on those nachos. Give it a shot!

I ordered a few drinks with my boys Tayton. He made the best AMF I've EVER had... EVER. Extremely happy, pleasant, and cheerful; Even at 4am! As a local, I know it's hard to find bartenders like this. I will definitely come back to this place. It's hard to find people like this on the strip.

Opened in the space formerly occupied by Central Richards.   
This cafe located across from the registration area is open 24/7. 

The owners, V & E, Cubans have a winner in this restaurant. The service great and professional. While we only eat breakfast at the cafe during our stay, this place is better than the 2 previous restaurants that occupied this space, namely the Augustus Cafe and Richards Central. They both were very good, but this place is better.

Tip if your watching your weight, even though your vacationing, share.

We share the all American breakfast and the split the plates for you. Forgot to take a pic. 

Huge portions. We each had 1 poached egg,  3 slices of smoked bacon, a bunch of breakfast potatoes and half an English muffin. Toooo much food! Delicious.

Very affordable. My wife the Cuban cook, by way of San Antonio del Los Banos, Cuba was very very happy with her breakfast! 

A+++++.

Poor quality of food and bad service. I called a bartender several times right in front of him he ignored. I had to wait for a menu for minutes.

Cheap meatball spaghetti, salty chicken wings and poke bowl with cold hard rice.

Service was not that great. Prices were outrageous but we were hungry so we stopped to eat. Our bill was even more outrageous as the restaurant charged us $30 for gratuity.
Needles to say I will never come back here, starving
or not

When I stay at Caesars Palace I always have my breakfast at Café Americano, the food is great and the service is even better. Richard, Freddie and Christina always take very good care of me. If you're staying at Caesars Palace I highly recommend you have breakfast, lunch or dinner at Café Americano. You won't be disappointed!

Had a quick lunch in this location.  The food was good and was a very large portion. I opted for the Cuban with fries.  There was a large group of us there for lunch, but the amount of time it took for burgers, Cuban, and BLT sandwiches was on the border of too long.  We did have a good server who was working hard to get orders in and keep drinks filled.  There was nothing that was horrible about the location, food or service, but nothing that really stood out to me so that is where the 3 stars came it.  It was convenient as well as not too busy for lunch so we were able to talk and catch up.

The selection is great. Lots of options to pick from: pizzas, soups, salads and sandwiches. It's located conveniently in the middle of Ceasars. I am warning you: portions are huge. I've ordered an appetizer of nachos, they were gigantic. Two of us got full, even not finishing the plate. Very nice service and vibrant ambiance. I liked for sure.

Went there with my boyfriend while we were staying at Caesars. The first time we sat outside on their amazing patio and Anthony was our bartender. He was so attentive and made the best mojitos! We must have sat there for 6 hrs! They have delicious food as well. Because of Anthony we came back the next 3 Days. We also met another bartender Chantel. She was so great to talk to and made a mean martini! Talk about great customer service!! Hands down the best bar in Vegas!!

The only reason I gave this restaurant 2 stars instead of 1 is because of the setting.  The food is bad and the bloody marys were the worst I've ever had in my life.  Top that off with outrageous prices and you've got a recipe for a very expensive disappointment.

Good food but very very expensive. Service was slow too which made no sense since was maybe 1/4 full with plenty of help around. 

Ordered 2 burger/fries plates and had to ask for condiments.  Also got 2 stir fry (lunch menu) meals. 

Food quality: 4 star

Service: 2 star

Cost: 1 star - ridiculously expensive. Our meals with tip were over $135

Unfortunately I ate here on fathers day. 

I ordered the all American breakfast scrambled eggs with cheddar.  They only have white cheddar, weak.  Home fries came with sweet potatoes mixed in. That's fine with me but should be mentioned on the menu. The bad part was the home fries came out luke warm to cold. 
The wifey ordered a salad with a mimosa.
My son ordered 1 pancake, not the stack, sausage, and sliced bananas and Apple juice
This meal came to $111... yes that is correct. Way over priced!
Good food, but watch out- it is EXPENSIVE! We're talking $100 breakfast for two people! As long as you're aware of that, the food is very fresh with good sized portions.

Took my family here for NYE. We had a reservation down but for some reason "we weren't in the system." But the hostess and manager had no issues with accommodating our group of 9 which was very surprising for such a busy night. Our waiter was very friendly and personable. I ordered the short ribs nachos and smokehouse burger w/ the salad amongst all the other dishes my family ordered. It wasn't until this burger that I realized how important patty density is. This burger was perfect in that department. The portions were relatively large and left my family feeling satisfied. Prices are a little expensive but for the quality and location, what do you expect. I ordered my typical drink, the Gin mule which came in copper mug, which is very crucial. The drink was very balanced, better then a lot of other mules I've had around town. I wouldn't hesitate to come back if I'm in the area.

A little expensive but it's in a hotel so it's to be expected. I ordered the egg white wrap and got the cilantro crema and ranchera salsa on the side. $2 for a side of salsa but again to be expected. My grandmother got the Belgian waffles. Both were delicious! And I'm normally not a huge fan of hash browns but I liked theirs. Our service was also very nice. There was some kind of mix up and I ended up with a burger with bacon I didn't order but they got it fixed promptly! For having the word cafe in their name I didn't see anything other than regular coffee but maybe I just missed it. All in all a good experience.

Navigating around Caesars Palace can be daunting but in all the chaos I discovered a constant haven of friendliness and really terrific food!!! My first morning( a very early 4:30 AM I was greeted by Taten and Robbie with excellent coffee and a welcome that set the tone of the rest of my trip- amazing!!! These two gentlemen had been up all night and still they were charming, attentive and funny. That goes a long way in Vegas! So I brought my husband back for breakfast and we met Kristina and Richard, a slam dunk!!! Could not have been nicer! The poached eggs and omelet were eggselent!!! Bloody Mary selection was creative and satisfying. These people are first class-kindness, personality, and bringing a bit of home to a great big place! So we finished our trip with a lovely breakfast of smoked salmon platter and omelet and our new friends!!! Same time next year returning with fond memories we will not forget anytime soon!!!
I got food poisoning. Honestly there are way better places to eat in vegas. Would NOT recommend. And the BLT was soooo gross

Came here with a big group and had a lot of fun! Saul was an EXCELLENT waiter! He was extremely accommodating and so friendly! He took such good care of us and had great recommendations for us. I had the short rib nachos and it was definitely enough to share with a couple friends! Overall, delicious food, cool ambiance, and attentive service!
Good food presentation. I like my Blood Mary a little spicer than they have offered but overall it was good.

My first impression looking at the menu was wow this place will be fantastic food look amazing and I am sure taste fantastic but when seating down the server assistant ask if we would like coffee we said yes do you have cafe latte or cappuccino and the server assistant well what do you want to be that reply was extremely rude they way he said it
Courtney was amazing. Best service I've had in Vegas thanks so much for making my stay extra special

Above average coffee shop. If your here for breakfast bring an appetite. Neither of us could finish the scrambled eggs with meat and potatoes. 
Seating was no problem mid week. The service was quick and efficient. Although it's probably more than you would expect to pay for breakfast you don't do it that often. The restaurant is one of two with full service and we like to have one great breakfast during our stay and it should hold us until dinner.

Had breakfast in here once during our four nights at Cesar's Palace.  A very eclectic menu for sure.  Many things you've heard of, but I went adventurous and had the Hand Held breakfast menu - with the short ribs, eggs, muchrooms, bacon and cheese on Cuban Bread.  It was a little dry, so I ordered the Ranchero sauce on the side and that fixed it up nicely.  Ordered a glass of OJ and it comes in a tiny little mason jar...not much if you are thirsty.  Waiter was decent.  I'd try a more routine item next time, but for a 24 hour restaurant, it wasn't bad.  I'd go back.

Food was average to slightly above, but nothing to write home about. Staff was fabulous. Ate there once everyday of my stay because it was convenient and the service was great all around. Ask for Keith.

I ordered the short rib beef nachos. My wife and I were able to share the huge amount of nachos. I have eaten breakfast and lunch several times at Cafe Americano . The food has always been tasty and the service has always been good. I definitely recommend the nachos.
We ate here a lot after the club. Everything is very good here. From the wings, to the nachos, chicken strips and the turkey sandwich ! Bartenders are VERY nice !

Saturday morning we had a wonderful server. I'm sorry I didn't get her name because she deserves to be recognized. There were seven of us and we are not big eaters and wanted our plates split so we could share. She told us the extra cost to split and we gladly paid it. The tea tasted great too. 
Now, Sunday morning was a different story. Completely different server. Asked for the plates to be split again and none of them were split. The tea tasted old, leftover. We had to ask another server to be asked for our check. All this to say your experience here will be deterred by who your server will be.
Food is ok.  Over priced.  Smell in dining area is disgusting.  Smells like a dirty grease trap. Only 24. Hour place in ceasars for food.

When you come to Vegas you expect a certain caliber of service and food. This restaurant was a serious disappointment. 
Service: Once we were seated the waiter took our drink orders and disappeared. When he reappeared he still did not have our drinks. Instead of staying the bar was backed up or that they were coming out momentarily. After about 15 min I finally asked for the drinks. Since he were returned to the table very quickly I'm guessing that he forgot about our drinks. The food took FOREVER to come. I'm guessing that he also forgot to put our food in. When we asked the manager where the food was he just indicated that they were busy without any pleasantries or apologies. Once we asked for checks he handed me the bill and told me to split the check my self -we were sitting with two other couples. Once he returned with our cards he gave them to me instead of giving each person their cards back. I dine out frequently this was just a mess.
Food: I ordered the chicken and waffles which was supposed to be one of one of their specialities. The waffle had too many flavors fused together. The chicken was... sweet. Odd. I just wasn't a fan of this place.

This place is overpriced. The food was good and the service was good but it wasn't $22 an omelette good. I get that it's Vegas and I'll pay a premium for that as well as good food but with that said, not sure it was THAT good. Putting an expensive restaurant in the lobby of a busy casino/resort means you get no peace and quiet but an expensive bill. The decor felt like a shitty hangover where you just do it because it has to be done. Would I go back? Maybe only if I have to and was staying here again.
The Margerita  pizza was good. The bartenders are good looking, charming, and entertaining. Overall we had an interesting night. This was definitely better than going to some food court.

Came here with a bunch of girls because we were staying at Caesars and this is the only place open past 11pm.  

Food is RIDICULOUSLY overpriced.  I got a bowl of French onion soup.  Cost $18 including tax and automatic gratuity (for parties of 8 or more).

Service sucked.  Waters went unrefilled.  When I asked someone for more water, he only refilled mine and not everyone else at the table.  We told our waitress we wanted the bill split.  She brought it to us not split.

Stars are only for the food.  It was edible/good but NOT worth almost $20.

Only go here if you're desperate.
Wish I could say something good about our breakfast visit.  You know you should turn around and leave when the coffee is only warm  and taste like water.  The food and service only got worse.
Really impressed with the tacos de carnitas and asada!!! They also have happy hour daily!!!

Yikes where to start...

I have walked by this cafe for years and always wanted to try it, so we gave it a whirl for lunch the other day and were thoroughly disappointed...

We were seated fairly quickly and greeted by our waiter who took orders. We got diet cokes, a chopped salad, a chicken salad, and a side salad with chicken. We asked for bread and butter and apparently they don't have any...huh? Our waiter got us some toast and butter which was nice, but still odd they didn't have regular bread and butter (being a cafe and all). Our food came and the only order that was correct was the chopped salad. The chicken salad didn't come with the right dressing, and the side salad didn't have any chicken. It took 15 more minutes to get some chicken and our waiter didn't seem to care at all. The salads were pretty good all around and I must say the dressings were superb. The cafe itself appears from the outside to be peaceful and inviting, but the inside of it does not flow well; it's crowded and loud. The staff is running around and no one seems to be on the same page. The experience was not great, but decent...until we got the check. Obviously we are in Vegas and things are pricey but holy smokes!!!! 3 diet cokes were $18, a side salad with chicken was $18, and our total bill for measly salads and lousy service was just about $100...absolute robbery! 

I suggest walking a few more steps to the Bellagio and go to their cafe, it is excellent!

Anyone who gives them less than five stars is nuts. And I'm basing that on the food only. The service was just ok, but the food was off the hook! I cannot say that enough! I had pancakes, which were the best pancakes I've ever had in my whole entire life! Out of this world!

I recently visited Vegas with my mom for her birthday. We stayed at Caeser Palace. We ate either breakfast, lunch and late dinners our entire stay. The clam chowder soup was the best I've ever tasted, the short rib nachos were delicious!! But most of all the service we received from our server Saoul and his manager we're impeccable, excellent, superb!! The bar star Chantel/Shantel made the best Cadillac Margarita I've ever tasted with sugar rim glass for me and salt for my mom!! She was a joy to talk to while sitting at bar and has a lovely attitude. I had her delicious potent drinks while dining and on the go!! I enjoy a good Margarita and hers was the best I've ever had in Vegas or any other city I've visited. Shantel and Saoul were the sole reason we ate their everyday during our visit, we couldn't get enough of this place!!! My mom and I had a great time and will most definitely be returning and staying at Caeser Palace! The breakfast and the New York Steak was also delicious!! Thank you all for making our stay and my mom's birthday rememberable!!! You ladies and Gentlemen ROCK!!! From daughter and her mommy!

This was my first time at this restaurant and the food was amazing! Super healthy ingredients. Eric S. was our waiter and he provided excellent service. Will definitely be back the next time I'm in Las Vegas!

Food is pretty good. Had the fish & chips for lunch - 5 stars. 
Had eggs over easy, hash browns, chicken sausage and sour dough toast for breakfast - 3 stars. Decent breakfast.
Open 24/7... food is A- OK for a restaurant that is open 24/7. Service needs to improve. Beggars can't be choosers or you can sleep hungry..

I would give it a 3.5 stars... The food was pretty good, the plates are HUGE! (not sure if I liked it or not...) and the cocktail I had was delicious. 

The service, however, was pretty slow and inconsistent. The cocktail arrived after the food has, and both took too long. We were served by few waitresses so no one exactly took care of us / was aware of our needs throughout the meal. 

Also, the check arrived before we asked for it even thought it's a 24h restaurant, so we didn't really feel like taking a look at desserts or anything. 

All in all - it's a good place for you if you're in the area and super hungry, but I wouldn't stand in line for it (if there's any) or make an effort to come.

WOW with just 2 checkins I became a regular!  

Cafe Americano is located in Caesar in Vegas.  

The service was great!   On the 1st visit they were a bit understaffed but they were so nice it was easy to deal with the wait.  The 2nd visit was at the bar which is a bit odd as it's technically in the hotel lobby.  

Two ladies at the table next to me were splitting the eggs bene with the caper hollandaise.  They both warned me that the sauce was a bit peppery but they were working on eating it via attempting to separate yolk from sauce.   The waiter got wind of their issue and had the kitchen remake the order with the milder hollandaise.   The ladies were shocked as they didn't request a refire. THAT'S GREAT SERVICE!!!!!

Breakfast runs between $25-30 dollars but the portions are large enough to share.  They will even divide the entree onto 2 plates.  Bloody Mary's runs $15 and coffee is $5.  This is not a cheap place to dine.  Total Rewards comps are welcomed.  

I'd go back the next time I'm in Vegas but I hope I have comps or winning to pay the bill!

We chose Cafe American for breakfast while staying at Caesar's. Lovely decor, clean and bright. Big TVs strategically located for diners' AM viewing pleasure.  
We were seated on arrival, water glasses filled, menus distributed. Server was pleasant and efficient, coffee fresh and delicious, refills offered. I had a breakfast burrito, hubby had hash and eggs. Hash browns were obviously house made, fresh grated, soft inside, nice and crispy outside-best part of the meal! Breakfast burrito was huge, otherwise pretty unremarkable. Over easy eggs reported as good, hash ok, nicely crisped. 24 hour service, conveniently located in hotel lobby, but pricey.

Please don't be fooled by its great location of right inside Caesar lobby.

Terrible service. 

7 friends ordered 7 dishes plus a pecan pie. After an hour of waiting, the waiting brought out 6 dishes (missing one order) plus a crumble looking pie. Turns out Two out of six are completely wrong orders. And when we questioned if it's a pecan pie, they asked us to cut into the pie open to double check - turns out it's a peach pie! What a surprise.

.....

Finally we received three correct orders plus a pecan pie.

.....

Truly a h-angry and befuddling experience

This place is excessively over priced. Every hotel/casino has their 24 hour café, where you can go and get a quick breakfast or lunch. They are usually reasonable. NOT this place. 22 dollars for a typical eggs, toast, potatoes and sausage. Steak and eggs will set you back 45 dollars. Subpar service goes with the extravagant prices. Never again.

The food is great, but unfortunately the service is non-existent.  We waited over an hour for a BLT and roasted chicken.  The manager was less than helpful, although he did remove the charge of our food served cold.

Absolutely go anywhere else in vegas but this restaurant. We sat down to order our food at 2:15 AM, the waiter did not put in our order until 2:47, and we did not receive our food until 3:20. The server refused to come by and fill up our water, and essentially avoided our table; taking preference to the tables full of drunk girls. When we addressed the manager, he took 15 minutes to even respond to our claim and when he did he raised his voice and threw the bill on the table. I have never received such rude, neglectful service in my entire life. And as a service industry worker, I can barely believe the level of gross incompetence and inattention to guests at this establishment. I would not go back here if it were the last place in vegas to eat and I was starving.

Let me just get to the worst part. The rudest thing I ever witnessed from a server.

 Me and my boss was in the middle of ordering and the server stopped looking at us and turned his head to watch the game. My boss had to stop midsentence because he was no longer paying attention to us... 

I was shocked. He was completely rude to us. All your employees were so focused on the damn soccer game that we were 2nd. Maybe if your staff can't handle TV's around them, it should be turned off. 

Horrible service!!!!!

This is a great spot to grab a bite to eat after a long night of entertainment on the Las Vegas Strip or if your flying in on a red eye. It's open 24 hours a day, and they offer quality breakfast, lunch, and dinner options at any hour. You'll definitely find something to fit any craving at this place. The service was great, and my eggs, potatoes, and bacon came out perfectly.  They also have a full service bar located at the front of the restaurant, right across from the hotel check-in. There's no better way to start your Vegas adventure than with a drink in your hand!

This place is great, and the other yelpers must not have had our server, busser, and manager.  My cousin and I walked from MGM to Bellagio and were really hungry, so we hesitantly walked into Caesar's "Café." They only had 3.5 stars, and I saw on yelp that their service was bad and their food overpriced. SO WRONG. My cousin had the chicken fingers w/ fries and got like 4 different sauces for $16. Expensive? Wrong! It was so much food and she took half of it home so in my opinion, it was like an $8 meal. I'm vegan, but my server, despite needing to take an order for a table of 12, patiently explained to me even more vegan options which expanded my options to about 9. At a lot of restaurants I go to, servers typically just offer me 1-2 modifications with an attitude. I ultimately settled on the spaghetti with giant meatballs but got the meatballs replaced with veggies. Our server also made sure that they didn't put Parmesan cheese in my spaghetti and gave me bread and olive oil to replace the usual nonvegan garlic bread that comes with the meal. Service stayed good throughout the whole meal, even though the place was short-staffed as we later found out after having a chat with Suda, the manager. She said that three people called in sick probably because it was Christmas night. Anyway, I had a good experience overall and would give more than five stars if I could!

My friends and I came here after the club.  Good thing they're 24 hours.  We order some drinks along with fish and chips and other finger foods.  Everything tasted good.  So glad they had sriracha.  I scarfed that down.
We didn't finish everything so we had our server get us boxes.  Then we needed more and another server went to get it.  I had asked for some sriracha to go and he said they didn't have it.  What a liar.  I called him out on that too calling him a liar.  Moments later he returned with a box and a container of sriracha...

Our main server was awesome.  He did everything as expect and beyond.

Very Good Breakfast Spot
The Food is a 7 out of 10, its one of the only places open early in Caesars. Great place to eat breakfast and watch the early football games on sunday.
The service was really good.
Not bad.  Chips and guacamole.....$16.00. Well, kinda steep in my opinion. Service was excellent.

24 hour restaurant located at Caesar's Palace. We went there for breakfast and liked the various choices available. Took a bit longer than we expected so I dropped my rating to 4 stars but the service was friendly and the food was very good once it was served.

I shouldn't say shitty service but they have 1 server covering a huge area and the manager in "blazers" are just standing around instead of helping. 

The food is your typical diner food, the cocktails are  subpar, over priced as always.

Our server did do his best but we had to approach the bar to order drinks a couple times. 

Over worked and underpaid I would guess.

We do not mind paying a little more for good food. Had omelette at $24 each and I can bet every casino chip I have that it was not cooked by a chef. Has browns were full of oil and potatoes hard. And if you advertise freshly squeezed orange juice please do not serve it from a Carton. So so disappointed. Avoid
This company has not paid me my final payroll, as of now its two  months. This is not the way a company should treat people, it's not nice or right!

Magic eggs!!!!! Order the magic eggs!!

They must be magic because when I ordered a Denver omelet $24 disappeared from my wallet...abracadabra, poof, gone. Combine that with an $8 orange juice and $5 coffee and you have yourself a stupid expensive breakfast. Adding to the ridiculously priced food the cafe plays thumping, loud dance club music at 6:30 AM to help you wake up. Next time I visit Caesars I'll make a point of leaving the building for an alternative to the Americano Cafe. Congratulations to the management for crossing the line and driving me to a competitor.

Pretty good casual restaurant, steak is a little bit chewy, nachos is excellent, tacos come in 3 and small portions, coffee is very good.
We got good service, our waiter is Jessica.

Was in Vegas nearly a week for a convention and had the opportunity to have two meals plus drinks and appetizers here. Their customer service was top-notch and the food fantastic on all four visits. Paloma (manager), Andrew (bartender), Maggie (server), Stephanie (hostess) and Tyler (server) all gave phenomenal customer service. Personable, attentive and professional, the staff at this restaurant is terrific. The salmon is wonderful, and I highly recommend the entire experience. Thanks!
El servicio fue excelente hoy por parte de Luis R., para mi el servicio es muy importante para volver a un lugar, y es muy conveniente por que está abierto 24 hrs.

Too expensive for what they serve but it's Vegas and late night at a casino not much options unless you drive. That's why all Vegas casino food places are a rip. Very few bargains left for food choices on the strip.

Standard fare, at a very high price because it's right by the lobby.  The food was ok, the server was a nice guy but service was slow because he had to handle such a large area.  This restaurant basically counts on the huge lineup and overflow of the front desk to catch hungry travelers that are pressed for time.  If you're on an expense account and don't have time, this is a convenient option.  Otherwise, I suggest elsewhere...

Huge portions but service is iffy. Look it's a Vegas big hotel 24/7 diner; I really wasn't expecting much. 

BUT the pork hash in the skillet with the added fried egg on top was divine and despite the excruciatingly long wait for our brekkie, the waiter knew to keep our cups filled with their good, strong coffee. 

You can't ask for much more than that.

Good presentation of food! The short rib nachos are probably best thing on the menu. I think this place is good, but not the best that Vegas has to offer. Order of wings came cold and have had better burgers and tacos. However, being that this place is open 24 hrs, I'm sure it would taste amazing at 3 or 4 am

They changed the name, because somany bed reviews. Late night i like to try one last time. Service slow, food is terrible. I don't give one star but this place always bad management, poor food quality. Sorry but for this hotel this cafe joking.

Before I review on the food I want to say how awesome our waiter Keith H. was, he was very polite and on top of his game. He made sure our glasses were full of what we were drinking, food was brought out and properly set on the table to make the presentation of our meal perfect. During meal he checked on us to make sure we were good and I noticed he was this way with all of his tables. 
The food was great a little pricey but it's Vegas everything is pricey.

This is a must have if you're in Vegas! The food is phenomenal! I had the loaded hash, this could definitely be shared between 2 people! My husband had the huevos rancheros, we are from Texas so this was kind of a test and he was very happy with it. Luis P. was a doll one of the nicest waiters I have met in Vegas! 

Definitely an A+ from us!! 

Ask for Luis P.

Trying to find a good cappuccino on the strip.  These guys serve LavAzza and it was don well.  Nice relaxing atmosphere outside on the patio.  Had the S'mores cheesecake with the coffee.  Really good super sweet but in a nice way.  
Did not have more than the coffee and desert but good experience.

Stopped in for lunch while in Vegas, this place is conveniently located right at Caesar's Palace so it's easy to get to from most hotels on the strip. We chose to eat outside, and enjoyed being able to eat patio-style but still see the games on the screens at the outdoor bar. The food was flavorful and light. The boxed combos are perfect for lunch. I had the quinoa salad which was quite good and the salmon which I adored. Cheers to them for having one of my favorite drafts, Golden Monkey, available. Great casual place in a convenient location.
Had the shrimp tacos..  blown away.  Best shrimp tacos that I've ever had.   Great, prompt service and OMG.....this tacos were amazing.

Our server was awesome.   We had a suite at the hotel and walked down to eat at somewhere quick....we wanted not to pricy since our dinner last night was almost $400... We both got a blue berry martini and my friend ordered the club sandwich and I just had the French Onion Soup....total was $72 :/  ...I personally felt that was kinda steep for a soup, sandwich and drink.... but the manager Adrian was awesome and came and greeted every table and was so awesome and patient and cool with my silly friend.  It really was great food though and awesome customer service.

This restaurant is located on the opposite side of the "check in" desk for the hotel. I've only had 2 plates here being the "All American Breakfast" and the "Steak & Eggs." The service here is pretty good on timing. They won't have you feeling left unattended after they've taken your order and served your meal. I felt the staff was professional and did their part. They don't play that "I didn't see/hear you" typa stuff like at other restaurants. Both the plates I ordered were made very well as well as for my family members. If you need condiments or anything extra just ask. For both my visits it seems they don't want to waste condiments so they'll give it upon request like sauces, ketchup, jams, etc. It's also nice that they have lines for people of status in Total Rewards because our first time eating there, there was a fat line but since my pops is diamond status, we got seated within 5 min which is really cool if you play with Total Rewards. The only thing I think was a little overboard was the price. I know we're in Vegas and all and the atmosphere is cool, but a traditional Steak & Eggs plate usually goes for $17-$22 at most place. Over here it was $45. Despite that it was actually cooked well, I still felt it was a bit too much that I didn't want it the first time around but on my 2nd visit I said I'll try it and wasn't disappointed. I would recommend this place if you're staying at the hotel and don't wanna lose more $$ and time by having to try and leave your hotel to go somewhere else. They also have tvs and played Sunday football which is also a plus.

Busy und lautes Durchschnitts Cafe/Bar
Direkt am Eingang des legendären Ceasars Palace 
Preise wie überall gehoben 
Aber zum Standard Breakfast akzeptabel
Breakfast startet bei 20$ 
Café und Juice satt 
Insgesamt gibt es in Vegas einige an Cafés - aber es kommt keines an die gemütlichen und traditionellen Europa Cafés heran - aber deswegen ist man ja auch nicht in Vegas

Tourist trap.  Expensive tourist trap.  There were 8 of us and we opted to eat outside for dinner.  (automatic 18% mandatory tip tacked on to our $500 bill). Waitress was snarky from the sit down.  When asked, she recommended we not get the Cuban sandwich because it "isn't very good, the owners aren't Cuban and don't know Cuban food".  I ordered a pizza and got something that seemed to be from the frozen aisle of any grocery store.  The nachos were good but 3 were ordered for the table, much of it went uneaten because the portions were so large.  It would behoove the waitress to warn of the sizes.  Maybe make them smaller portions with a smaller price tag.  If you go, plan on sharing.  Only one person in our group cleaned their plate.  The food was just not that good.  The waitress's sarcasm and snark pretty much ruined the meal for me.  She took it upon herself to try to entertain our table by picking on and demeaning the men at our table.  Ugh.  No, not what we do.

Had their pizza to go and dined there for breakfast. Everything was very well made and delicious. 
The sandwiches are huge, and that definitely makes for good sharing choices if you're watching your budget. However, $13 for a mimosa is just crazy. Vegas in general is just expensive when you eat at the convenience of these cafes, but just share wisely. $20 for a tiny pizza is also not the business, but it was good! So.... just pick your battles for whatever suits you. 

Overall seating areas and look is awesome and super easy to get to.  Service both times was just great! They're on it.

For a 24 hour casino diner, its very pricey...very.  No kids menu, lost a star.  But they did a side of mac and cheese for my boy, it was great.  Side salad was great and the nachos are pretty bomb.  Huge to share and worth the $23 yes for nachos!  But damn good!  Service was on it.  Atmosphere is great and so is the bar.

The food isn't bad it's just not good. The wings were fine nothing spectacular, the chicken fingers were a little to crispy. I think they fry everything hard. The fries were on the colder side and the Caesar salad was plain. The best thing they got going is that they're 24 hours
The corned beef hash and the Bellini were delicious and the service was quick and courteous.
Totally serviceable food at reasonable prices. Not gonna knock your sox off, but it gets the job done. Had a salad and an omelette here. No complaints.

I needed something to eat in a hurry to hadn't yet discovered the Forum Food Court in Caesars, so I stopped by this place (because it's in the lobby and one of 1st places you see... plus, it is open 24 hours). I ordered a BBQ chicken breast sandwich. The chicken breast was thick and juicy, grilled very nicely and basted (not drowned) with BBQ sauce. I could've done without the horribly over-fried onion ring on top, but it was a a really good sandwich overall. The fries weren't bad either. 

The staff here does the bare minimum. We decided to eat at the bar instead of take it to go and not once did anyone stop to offer us napkins/condiments or ask if we wanted a drink.

This restaurant is way too overpriced, the burgers are average, in n out burgers are way better. I got the hangover burger and the braised pork in it was soooo hard. I really recommend not coming here because the food isn't really that good and the price is definitely not worth the average quality u get. I only rated it 2 stars just for the food service, other than that, this place is not worth the money. $25 for a piece of shit burger!

I am going to leave an update. I went to Americano next morning to have breakfast. I liked everything but.... it was so expensive!!! We ordered an ordinary meal and it was not very special. It's not a fancy special place and it doesn't have a special food. It shouldn't be this expensive!!!

Food was really tasty, however the guacamole avocado type sauce has a little bit of a texture thing that wasn't my favorite. We got the brisket nachos and they were great. I also had one of their lemon blueberry martinis and it was delicious. Very well balanced with little "alcohol" flavor. Super impressed.
What an amazing 24 hour cafe. It's more of a 24 hour hipster restaurant. Very trendy decor and good food.  Thank you for the awesome service Saul.

Great food in Caesars Palace 24 hrs a day.  Breakfast is excellent. Go hungry because portions are big!  We always have good service, food comes quickly. Ask to be in Josue's section--he is an exceptional friendly server, by far the standout here. His section is often the most crowded!!

My husband and I were at a conference and stayed at Cesar's Palace. We frequently went to cafe Americano for breakfast. The pancakes are fluffy and delicious! Also the egg white omelette was full of fresh veggies and very tasty! The portions are huge. Service was good but a little slow during the busy times. All the staff had upbeat attitudes. We would definitely come back here to eat when we return to Las Vegas!

We visited here this evening. I ordered the blackened mahi tacos. They were the worst tacos i've ever had anywhere. The food is more pricey than is should be to begin with anyway. Our server took our order and never returned again until we needed the check. This is not worth the visit.
Try the Cuban sandwich. This restaurant is a great spot to relax and people watch. The food is excellent with good friendly service. I would like to return here on my next trip to Vegas.

The late night wait staff was nice.  Period.   We went in because nothing else was open after a concert.  
My girlfriend had a pepperoni pizza that tasted worse than worst cardboard flavored frozen pizza.   It was really, really bad. 
I had the spaghetti and giant meatball which is something that I never order.  It was like getting a Chef Boyardee crater with a giant round cold meatloaf meteor in the crater.  Nasty alien stuff.  
To add injury we were looking at a $50+ bill for the crap.  
All I can say is plan ahead if you need to eat late at Caesars.  You have been warned.

I give this Resturant 5 stars due to the phenomenal service of Robbie the greatest. My second time siting at the bar and having his wonderful and most attentive service and 3rd time attending  this restaurant that prompt me to put in a good word in for my favorite waiter! Cafe americano keep up people like Robbie around and u'll Have late ngt visitors all ngt Long! ND btw the roasted red pepper bisque

If you want phenomenal drinks and a staff that caters to your every drink need, this is the place to go. Luis S is the BEST bartender I have come across in Las Vegas. His customer service supersedes all expectations in the City of Sin. His service is fast and friendly and he's got the inside scoop on the strip.

Been here before and service was pretty good but today they seemed to be understaffed service was very slow had to flag down to get coffee after over 10 min.  Flag down to order another  another 10 min. Table next to us sat down 15 min. after us and got there food first when our food arrived it was warm at best. Very disappointed.

Located near the reception area, it's definitely an easy access. We were looking to eat a pretty late lunch (around 3pm), and since this place was open 24 hours, it was perfect for us. The service was nice, very quick four requests. However,  the food itself was not great, and to price a burger at $23, regardless of where, I still expect juicy bites. I ended up getting the Carolina Melt; the portion size was definitely nice,  but the burger itself seemed lacking in flacor and a little dry in my opinion. Also, there was an imbalance of cheese, covering every bite. The classic burger also did not look too appealing, seeming a little bland. However, its convenience definitely helped.

Great spot for breakfast - they have a couple of all day breakfast items (just in case you slept in). Enjoyed the fresh avocado and bacon add on with my eggs that were cooked perfectly. Tip: ask for your coffee to go when leaving and enjoy your cup while walking to your next destination.

I placed on order to go after a night of partying and gambling and the food was terrible. Everything taste extremely salty. I called the next day to complain and the manger Suda said "There is nothing she can do and that I waited too long to call and complain" I explained to her that I was up all day traveling to Vegas and that I didn't know that there was a time limit on a complaint. I stay at Caesars Palace all the time and I've never had food that bad and customer service so unwilling to listen to a complaint. I went as far as to tell her that I didn't eat the food and she said " There's nothing she can do". I refuse to ever eat at an establishment that has that kind of customer service.

This place sucks ass , inside a busy hotel , starving barley had anything ..... but no one is planning to serve us anytime soon ... still waiting 15 mins later .. people work here just passing by looking at us and not giving a flying fuck .. and who charges $50 for 3 eggs

This was the only friendly staffed place during 2 day stay in Vegas.
Friend had a room associated VIP card and we (2 of us) could use $150 worth of food.  

We ordered bunch of food including $45 (maybe 47) steak visioning a French chef putting fingers near his lips saying things I wouldn't understand.
Hell no.... it was no better than $15-ish steak from Sizzler.... quite possibly worse.

I've never tried a poke so can't really tell if it's good or not, but it didn't impress me at all.

Clam chowder was GOOD.  It had lots of real clams and thick bacon pieces.  Bacon was a bit too thick to my taste, but still it was one of the best I've ever tried.

Food overall was better than other famous places, but prices were extreme.  I won't visit this place if costs wouldn't be covered.  Looks like everything in Vegas are now bubbled up where hotels provide and cover very high limit on meals, but food prices all went up as well.  There's no chance that I pay for it on my own.


On a side note....
I am one to think and say racism doesn't really exist in US, but I sensed strange racially biased vibes all along in Vegas.  Staff at many places were saying nonsense and didn't seem to answer what we asked.

This place was the only exception in Vegas where I didn't "felt" being a bit discriminated.... maybe I just looked poor....  Anyhow, I felt welcomed here.  Will I come back ?  Unlikely.
This was the most i have ever paid for breakfast...however it was money well spent. The foot was scrumptious and the service was great...
